commit_message:
Remove tests/tempest path from devstack and tox

Commit I3082962841d3b645f3cbd1a6b41fc7fb28dcf7e6 removed
octavia/tests/tempest directory
This patch removed other references to this path.

Change-Id: I665503aa4f69308ff31be53824b26faea13d2ad1

subject: Support context function argument as keyword
messages:
[{'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-02-14 12:29:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-02-14 14:51:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi there, and thanks for this patch.

my concerns are:

1. the reason "context" is a positional argument is because it's required; the intent of the new enginefacade was to take us from a world of ad-hoc Python idioms and messy transaction management to one where there's a very singular and strict pattern which would be adhered to.   It's not clear what we are gaining by adding this option other than it begins to suggest that "context" is optional.   If we are looking for "context" to be optional for a function that conditionally doesn't want to do any database work (which would be odd), that should be made clear in the commit message and tests.

2. the name "context" as the name of the argument is being invented here.   There's a non-zero chance this is backwards incompatible:
    
     my_existing_function(ctx, context=some_other_context)



that said, I'm not terribly concerned with this but I do want to ensure enginefacade is not diluted in its usage, because that's how openstack gets itself into trouble.'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-02-14 17:32:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Michael,
I was not aware of the notion that calling a method with keyword args implies the keys provided are optional (while i am aware that defining a method with keyword args does make the defined parameters optional).
My perspective is that it's just another way to invoke a method call.

since i noticed the 'context' arg being used in several projects, i thought it will be useful to allow its usage as a keyword argument.

someone (e.g me :) ) who uses ad-hoc Python idioms may choose to call a method with keyword arguments only. this would then result in a cryptic "index out of rage" error.'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-02-14 17:36:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Maybe limit this to when there are no positional arguments (except maybe self or cls) ?'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-02-14 18:20:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think lets just try to make it "context" as a kw argument, because if we did have a function like this:

   def my_func(self, context, x, y):

as you said, it is legal to pass "context" as a kw and that doesn't imply it isn't required.   

we do just need to make sure, maybe with a codesearch, that nobody has the name "context" repurposed in some way though this is very unlikely.'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-02-17 11:52:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-02-17 12:01:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

"we do just need to make sure, maybe with a codesearch, that nobody has the name "context" repurposed in some way though this is very unlikely."

ive added a check to make sure context.__class__ had the transaction_context_provider decorator applied (checking existence of a class attribute) before using it as "the context".

let me know if that's what you had in mind.
(will add missing unit tests for this logic if that's the correct direction)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-04-03 10:48:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

This _looks_ OK, but I'm not going to +2 until someone more knowledgeable has given it their sign off"}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-04-03 14:20:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-04-04 10:48:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-04-04 12:53:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-04-04 14:26:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-04-04 18:01:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-04-04 18:37:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-04-05 02:57:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-04-07 15:58:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-04-07 16:20:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-04-23 14:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-05-03 16:28:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

I'm happy with this now but I'm holding off on the +2 til Michael comes back around"}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-05-09 19:12:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

This matches my understanding of what Mike was asking for. Would also like him to have the final say on this, but I think we're good to go."}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-05-11 15:47:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

yes that was it'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-05-13 13:36:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The pep8 failures don't seem related to the commit.
Also I see the same failures in [1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/649328/"}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-05-13 14:02:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

OK, the failure related to:
https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488

need to downgrade to bandit 1.5.1'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-05-15 16:07:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-14 12:29:30.000000000', 'message': 'Support context function argument as keyword

Today, when a user uses enginefacade reader/writer decorators
he/she is forced to pass the context argument as the
first positional argument. performing a decorated function
call with this argument passed as a keyword would lead to
an out of range exception.

This patch proposes to add support for the context argument
to be passed as a keyword argument in decorated functions.

e.g

@enginefacade.reader
def foo(context):
    ...

foo(context=ctxt)  <- will now be possible

Change-Id: Ief0b71bf9a7eb75935612431bdcc26d33bce852d

foo(context=ctxt)  <- will now be possible

commit_message:
Support context function argument as keyword

Today, when a user uses enginefacade reader/writer decorators
he/she is forced to pass the context argument as the
first positional argument. performing a decorated function
call with this argument passed as a keyword would lead to
an out of range exception.

This patch proposes to add support for the context argument
to be passed as a keyword argument in decorated functions.

e.g

@enginefacade.reader
def foo(context):
    ...

commit_message:
Make sure amphora logging works the same on py2 and py3

In Python 3.3 IOError is just an alias of OSError. This
causes logging in a very specific scenario to not log
the appropriate message, as one code path is unreachable. 
This is fixed in this patch by merging the two exception paths.

Story: 2005576
Task: 30765

Change-Id: Ie81de8e85753fde1516aea0b084df6a0c513ad7b

Currently the weight value is hardcoded for anti-affinity type
preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.  This ps updates
the htk function to retrieve the weight value from the configured

commit_message:
HTK: Update kubernetes_pod_anti_affinity function

Currently the weight value is hardcoded for anti-affinity type
preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.  This ps updates
the htk function to retrieve the weight value from the configured
setting if it exists, or default to use the original hardcoded
value of 10 if it is not set (for backward compatibility).

Change-Id: I98c8b05ed7861c9c17e9c32569f53bde6ac2579d

commit_message:
Update hacking version to latest

This resolves extranous "improper escape sequence" warnings on
python 3.6+[1].

Note, this does not resolve those warnings from pylint. There
is already another proposed patch to address pylint[2].

commit_message:
Modified the way fluentd configures rsyslog

Fluentd makes rsyslog to send the logs to fluentd locally.
This configuration was create within the puppet-tripleo,
mounting the /etc/rsyslog.d/ directory on the fluentd
container. This generates an issue when is deployed on
RHEL BZ #1701726.

This patch aim to fix it.
 - The /etc/rsyslog.d directory is no longer mounted
 on the fluentd container.
 - The rsyslog configuration was moved to the host_prep_tasks.

Depends-On: I388180dc991926ff30f8bbc556f61447152f8dc9
Change-Id: Iae610832c12d63bde1eb507ba4bb89f2e3cfa24b
(cherry picked from commit bbbca8d65d13d2a8aa239fe3491f1787240bf7e6)

commit_message:
Adapt check-docker-health for podman

This patch changes default sensu-client standalone check to work
for podman deployments instead of docker deployments.

It also fixes the syntax error in list_concat for volumes and error
in containers-default.yaml path.

Change-Id: I5b1790279197a1c31f32405e673c31ec889a4647
(cherry picked from commit 44d6d689e135e4bb7b8bacf06e3453f66ab0aa36)

subject: Fix Jinja2's default filter usage
messages: [{'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-05-15 09:17:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-05-15 14:16:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-15 09:17:28.000000000', 'message': "Fix Jinja2's default filter usage

The default() filter provided by Jinja2 treats the special class
Undefined differently from False-y Python values. By default, default()
will only return its first argument if the prior expression evaluates to
Undefined. The second boolean parameter asks the function to also accept
Python False-y values as undefined and return the default value.

In these two roles, the variables retrieved from configuration files may
not be present and the default function won't work since these variables
will be 'Undefined' or set to an empty string.

Change-Id: Ib2cb1f94c71409477eb18d55f160d57dc5850ead
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit d483ace379e04547fca872bf65a8f1650c98064d)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Jinja2's default filter usage

The default() filter provided by Jinja2 treats the special class
Undefined differently from False-y Python values. By default, default()
will only return its first argument if the prior expression evaluates to
Undefined. The second boolean parameter asks the function to also accept
Python False-y values as undefined and return the default value.

In these two roles, the variables retrieved from configuration files may
not be present and the default function won't work since these variables
will be 'Undefined' or set to an empty string.

Change-Id: Ib2cb1f94c71409477eb18d55f160d57dc5850ead
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit d483ace379e04547fca872bf65a8f1650c98064d)

commit_message:
Remove nova placement API

Placement is now a separate service and has been removed from nova[1]
and implemented as a separate service in OSA[2]. As such, the nova
in-tree placement API is now disabled and can be removed.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/618215/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/656891/

Depends-On: I01df855d8b9255d24efe16ab053ffa491fda351f
Depends-On: I25ce79b9e3492cb075c50beed90ea2b78055e474
Change-Id: I2f5d4c2f1fc1418bc4f4c4baa1ce3c90b88208fc

[{'created': '2019-05-08 18:49:38.000000000', 'message': 'Remove prevent-arp-spoofing warning messages.

This patch removes prevent-arp-spoofing warning log messages when it is
set to true, and the OpenStack release is >= otaca. It does not remove
the configuration option itself.

Also, it adds a .jujuignore file to prevent errors on functional tests.

Change-Id: Iabd5a5eb01ed7aa8766396230668c6a1d674bbbe
Closes-Bug: 1754386
'}]
commit_message:
Remove prevent-arp-spoofing warning messages.

This patch removes prevent-arp-spoofing warning log messages when it is
set to true, and the OpenStack release is >= otaca. It does not remove
the configuration option itself.

Also, it adds a .jujuignore file to prevent errors on functional tests.

Change-Id: Iabd5a5eb01ed7aa8766396230668c6a1d674bbbe
Closes-Bug: 1754386

messages: [{'account_id': 30223, 'date': '2019-05-03 14:30:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30223, 'date': '2019-05-15 18:34:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nIt was submitted a fix at https://github.com/juju/charm/pull/275'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-03 14:30:46.000000000', 'message': 'Juju is rejecting repackaging on the functional tests:

DEBUG:runner: ERROR cannot repackage charm: symlink
".tox/func27/include/python2.7" is absolute: "/usr/include/python2.7"

.jujuignore is supported by Juju as stated on
https://bugs.launchpad.net/juju/+bug/1813799

This change adds a .jujuignore file with the .tox directory.

Change-Id: I18be026e96b2f3fff76a5e0f03fc90634497a7f4
'}]
commit_message:
Juju is rejecting repackaging on the functional tests:

DEBUG:runner: ERROR cannot repackage charm: symlink
".tox/func27/include/python2.7" is absolute: "/usr/include/python2.7"

.jujuignore is supported by Juju as stated on
https://bugs.launchpad.net/juju/+bug/1813799

This change adds a .jujuignore file with the .tox directory.

Change-Id: I18be026e96b2f3fff76a5e0f03fc90634497a7f4

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-15 15:17:26.000000000', 'message': 'Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start capping
it there as well.

Change-Id: I659571d084247a6a180d5b665921791d3647038f
Reference: https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489
'}]
commit_message:
Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start capping
it there as well.

Change-Id: I659571d084247a6a180d5b665921791d3647038f
Reference: https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

commit_message:
Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start capping
it there as well.

Change-Id: Ib340f5822b124e78cd96ee12f9f033d5f313e238
Reference: https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

commit_message:
Make puppet-4 beaker jobs voting

These jobs should all be green and nearly all Infra services have been
converted to puppet-4 anyway, so make sure they are voting. A subsequent
patch will remove the puppet-3 jobs altogether.

Change-Id: I5036b254d04ed495eda149f3dcb8eefaed0c3a5c

Update constraint for bandit.

Update the constraint for bandit to new release 1.6.0. This
release change the behavior of the -x options so that it now supports
glob patterns.

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I67c50430ced6efcc2f29ec7d8adc871415922d6f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start
capping it there as well.

Change-Id: Ie6b379f2c99862c37891ac03c52464e07bc2b2cc

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-12 20:37:09.000000000', 'message': 'Delete allocations even if _confirm_resize raises

When we are confirming a resize, the guest is on the dest
host and the instance host/node values in the database
are pointing at the dest host, so the _confirm_resize method
on the source is really best effort. If something fails, we
should not leak allocations in placement for the source compute
node resource provider since the instance is not actually
consuming the source node provider resources.

This change refactors the error handling around the _confirm_resize
call so the big nesting for _error_out_instance_on_exception is
moved to confirm_resize and then a try/finally is added around
_confirm_resize so we can be sure to try and cleanup the allocations
even if _confirm_resize fails in some obscure way. If _confirm_resize
does fail, the error gets re-raised along with logging a traceback
and hint about how to correct the instance state in the DB by hard
rebooting the server on the dest host.

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/manager.py
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

NOTE(mriedem): The manager.py conflict is due to not having change
Ibb8c12fb2799bb5ceb9e3d72a2b86dbb4f14451e in Rocky. In addition,
since change I0851e2d54a1fdc82fe3291fb7e286e790f121e92 is not in
Rocky the _delete_allocation_after_move signature needs to be
handled a bit different in this backport. The test_compute_mgr.py
conflict and source_node addition in the setUp is due to the same
two changes.

Change-Id: I29c5f491ec20a71283190a1599e7732541de736f
Closes-Bug: #1821594
(cherry picked from commit 03a6d26691c1f182224d59190b79f48df278099e)
(cherry picked from commit 5f515060f6c79f113f7b8107596e41056445c79f)
'}, {'created': '2019-04-12 21:22:12.000000000', 'message': 'Delete allocations even if _confirm_resize raises

When we are confirming a resize, the guest is on the dest
host and the instance host/node values in the database
are pointing at the dest host, so the _confirm_resize method
on the source is really best effort. If something fails, we
should not leak allocations in placement for the source compute
node resource provider since the instance is not actually
consuming the source node provider resources.

This change refactors the error handling around the _confirm_resize
call so the big nesting for _error_out_instance_on_exception is
moved to confirm_resize and then a try/finally is added around
_confirm_resize so we can be sure to try and cleanup the allocations
even if _confirm_resize fails in some obscure way. If _confirm_resize
does fail, the error gets re-raised along with logging a traceback
and hint about how to correct the instance state in the DB by hard
rebooting the server on the dest host.

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/manager.py
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

NOTE(mriedem): The manager.py conflict is due to not having change
Ibb8c12fb2799bb5ceb9e3d72a2b86dbb4f14451e in Rocky. In addition,
since change I0851e2d54a1fdc82fe3291fb7e286e790f121e92 is not in
Rocky the _delete_allocation_after_move signature needs to be
handled a bit different in this backport. The test_compute_mgr.py
conflict and source_node addition in the setUp is due to the same
two changes.

Change-Id: I29c5f491ec20a71283190a1599e7732541de736f
Closes-Bug: #1821594
(cherry picked from commit 03a6d26691c1f182224d59190b79f48df278099e)
(cherry picked from commit 5f515060f6c79f113f7b8107596e41056445c79f)
'}]
commit_message:
Delete allocations even if _confirm_resize raises

When we are confirming a resize, the guest is on the dest
host and the instance host/node values in the database
are pointing at the dest host, so the _confirm_resize method
on the source is really best effort. If something fails, we
should not leak allocations in placement for the source compute
node resource provider since the instance is not actually
consuming the source node provider resources.

This change refactors the error handling around the _confirm_resize
call so the big nesting for _error_out_instance_on_exception is
moved to confirm_resize and then a try/finally is added around
_confirm_resize so we can be sure to try and cleanup the allocations
even if _confirm_resize fails in some obscure way. If _confirm_resize
does fail, the error gets re-raised along with logging a traceback
and hint about how to correct the instance state in the DB by hard
rebooting the server on the dest host.

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/manager.py
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

NOTE(mriedem): The manager.py conflict is due to not having change
Ibb8c12fb2799bb5ceb9e3d72a2b86dbb4f14451e in Rocky. In addition,
since change I0851e2d54a1fdc82fe3291fb7e286e790f121e92 is not in
Rocky the _delete_allocation_after_move signature needs to be
handled a bit different in this backport. The test_compute_mgr.py
conflict and source_node addition in the setUp is due to the same
two changes.

Change-Id: I29c5f491ec20a71283190a1599e7732541de736f
Closes-Bug: #1821594
(cherry picked from commit 03a6d26691c1f182224d59190b79f48df278099e)
(cherry picked from commit 5f515060f6c79f113f7b8107596e41056445c79f)

commit_message:
Postgresql: Fix security context

This PS fixes the use of the security context macros for the
postgresql chart

Change-Id: I7d5080686e98837b95297b9a33e7241c79193830

commit_message:
Ceph: Dont attempt to reuse monmap if it exists

This PS forces the monmap to be clobbered each time the container starts
which is required to recover from ome senarios when using an emptydir
to back /etc/ceph.

Change-Id: I2cf271593591ce07435893336cff98a8b1c72166
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Add python3-wsme package to glance-api overrides

python3-wsme is required for [1]. This patch adds required packages to
kolla_templates_overrides when python3 is detected.

Closes-bug: rhbz#1710462

[1] https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/db/__init__.py#L22

Change-Id: Ie54d31c326c17d4a9fe8c1559d08f0bbd0c8398a

Link to baremetal API reference from patch_node

API operation, Update Node (PATCH /v1/nodes/{node_ident}).

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: I0ed9abe2277a95894bdaad9c29a0cd6e04645394

'}]

add python 3.7 unit test job

commit_message:
Blacklist bandit 1.6.0 in test-requirements and update sphinx versions

There is a bug in bandit[1] that causes tox pep8 test to fail
as it does not respect the excluded directories.

This change excludes this version from being used during tests
as oslo.db tests cause several violations.

The second change aligns sphinx requirements to OpenStack global
requirements as sphinx 2.0.0 onwards does not support python 2.7.
This change is required to be submitted in the same patch as unit
tests fails.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488

Change-Id: I1543836873fe065d58c85217b627f2d2c569a219

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-15 02:00:54.000000000', 'message': 'Skip _exclude_nested_providers() if not nested

In rocky cycle, 'GET /allocation_candidates' started to be aware of
nested providers from microversion 1.29, namely, it can have multiple
allocations from multiple resource providers in the same tree in the
allocation requests.

To keep the behavior of microversion before 1.29, it added a filters
to exculde nested providers being unaware of the nested architecture.
However that function "_exclude_nested_providers()" is very heavy
and is executed even if there is no nested provider in the environment
when microversion < 1.29.

This patch changes it to skip it if there is no nested provider.

Since _exclude_nested_providers() should be done before limitting
the candidates, this patch also moves it from hander file to the
deeper layer.

Change-Id: I4efdc65395e69a6d33fba927018d003cce26fa68
Story: 2005669
Task: 30980
(cherry picked from commit 727fb88dccfe8461cc40ae53ca2d4e40fd2a9c3c)
'}]
commit_message:
Skip _exclude_nested_providers() if not nested

In rocky cycle, 'GET /allocation_candidates' started to be aware of
nested providers from microversion 1.29, namely, it can have multiple
allocations from multiple resource providers in the same tree in the
allocation requests.

To keep the behavior of microversion before 1.29, it added a filters
to exculde nested providers being unaware of the nested architecture.
However that function "_exclude_nested_providers()" is very heavy
and is executed even if there is no nested provider in the environment
when microversion < 1.29.

This patch changes it to skip it if there is no nested provider.

Since _exclude_nested_providers() should be done before limitting
the candidates, this patch also moves it from hander file to the
deeper layer.

Change-Id: I4efdc65395e69a6d33fba927018d003cce26fa68
Story: 2005669
Task: 30980
(cherry picked from commit 727fb88dccfe8461cc40ae53ca2d4e40fd2a9c3c)

commit_message:
Use upper constraints

Sphinx 2.0.0 dropped python 2.7 and 3.4 support. Because osprofiler
uses global upper-constraints.txt only from Rocky,
job openstack-tox-py27 tries to install Sphinx 2.0.1 and fails [1] with:

 Downloading http://mirror.iad.rax.openstack.org/wheel/ubuntu-16.04-x86_64/sphinx/Sphinx-2.0.1-py2.py3-none-any.whl (3.2MB)
 ERROR: Sphinx requires Python '>=3.5' but the running Python is 2.7.12

Note: .[oslo.config] could be removed as the packages will be installed
perfectly and constrained without this and it breaks installation if
upper-constraints.txt is used anyway.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic-stable/opendev.org/openstack/osprofiler/stable/queens/openstack-tox-py27/3d469d3/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-05-10_06_10_56_192617

Change-Id: Ife6bcaca347d914cb1fc7e2fe71665ea5c93ca80

commit_message:
Gate jobs are voting

Make grenade-devstack-barbican voting, all gate jobs should be voting -
or not run in gate at all since they only waste resources and get
ignored. The job is passing, so making it voting is the proper change.

Rename job also to follow naming guidelines for zuul jobs, see
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#naming-with-zuul-v3

Change-Id: Ib5691b03e360631658e7fd80f958f55030a29782

commit_message:
Blacklist bandit 1.6.0 and cap Sphinx on Python2

There's a regression[0] in bandit 1.6.0 which causes bandit to stop
respecting excluded directories, and our tests throw a bunch of
violations. Blacklist this version, but allow newer versions as there is
already a pull request[1] to fix it, and I expect it will be included in
the next release.

Also fix the requirements job which was broken by
https://review.opendev.org/657890 adding a cap on Sphinx on Python 2.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

Change-Id: Ieabcd4e8c5e5354125a63e89b9b60931c760858a

And of course we should add documentation, unit tests and tempest tests.'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-12-05 11:31:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28695, 'date': '2018-12-05 11:44:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28695, 'date': '2018-12-05 12:04:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 28695, 'date': '2018-12-05 12:10:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks All for reviews. Applied most of the fixes. Still need to spend some time on manual verification and minor refactorings.

Do we want to have unit tests at this stage of development?'}, {'account_id': 28695, 'date': '2018-12-23 15:06:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-12-23 15:53:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

But if it gets too complicated then let's merge the current change."}, {'account_id': 28695, 'date': '2018-12-23 17:34:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-12-25 11:24:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

A question to 	Bartosz and  all reviewers:
I'm not sure if we can complete the entire implementation for Stein, since the spec is not finished yet (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627180/). 

Does it make sense to approve this change, maybe with some modifications, as a baseline for the integration? will it be useful? or should we finish the configuration part first?"}, {'account_id': 28695, 'date': '2019-02-25 12:02:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> A question to 	Bartosz and  all reviewers:
 > I'm not sure if we can complete the entire implementation for
 > Stein, since the spec is not finished yet (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627180/).
 > 
 > Does it make sense to approve this change, maybe with some
 > modifications, as a baseline for the integration? will it be
 > useful? or should we finish the configuration part first?

In my opinion the change is valuable in the sense that alarm mapping based on resource_id/resource_type provided by user should be anyway adopted in the final implementation. It may be used for handling the case in which there is no standard mapping between alarms and resources in Entity Graph, and providing ID explicitely is the only way to include alarms in the grpah. Integration with Monasca client may be also valuable."}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-02-25 12:14:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> > A question to 	Bartosz and  all reviewers:
 > > I'm not sure if we can complete the entire implementation for

 > >
 > > Does it make sense to approve this change, maybe with some
 > > modifications, as a baseline for the integration? will it be
 > > useful? or should we finish the configuration part first?
 > 
 > In my opinion the change is valuable in the sense that alarm
 > mapping based on resource_id/resource_type provided by user should
 > be anyway adopted in the final implementation. It may be used for
 > handling the case in which there is no standard mapping between
 > alarms and resources in Entity Graph, and providing ID explicitely
 > is the only way to include alarms in the grpah. Integration with
 > Monasca client may be also valuable.

Agree, I think it's good approach."}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2019-02-25 14:45:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> > In my opinion the change is valuable in the sense that alarm
 > > mapping based on resource_id/resource_type provided by user
 > should
 > > be anyway adopted in the final implementation. It may be used for
 > > handling the case in which there is no standard mapping between
 > > alarms and resources in Entity Graph, and providing ID
 > explicitely
 > > is the only way to include alarms in the grpah. Integration with
 > > Monasca client may be also valuable.
 > 
 > Agree, I think it's good approach.

Ok, sounds good. I see there is a merge conflict and some unanswered review comments, but other than that I think we can approve this change for Stein."}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-03-05 13:15:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add Monasca datasource

Introduces Monasca datasource enabling Monasca alerts in Vitrage
Entity Graph.

Change-Id: Ib3549c404c84e549f66e6057368c3f227bfe806a
Signed-off-by: Bartosz Zurkowski <b.zurkowski@samsung.com>

collect standalone deployment config

puppet config, config-download, and
rendered roles and playbooks are stored
in undercloud-ansible-* in standalone
deployments.

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit f586e321928e44e888f240e64ff9e201d527f9b8'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2019-05-14 23:11:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2019-05-14 23:57:32.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to bandit_exclusion_designate'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2019-05-15 00:04:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I believe the choice made on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/658258/ was not the best one.

I've re-proposed a similar fix here, which is easily backported (backporting reqs changes is unsightly, if it's even allowed).

It didn't turn out to be as relevant for designate, but the new bandit did have other changes (new rules) that should be run, and will be run in future versions too (keystone had to fix things due to this, that were missed originally with blacklisting, see:\xa0https://review.opendev.org/#/c/659164/).

Overall, blacklisting a requirement seems like an overkill reaction to something that's solved by adding an asterisk and some quotes..."}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-05-15 02:08:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Personally I don't have an issue with --exclude tests, as while it's broken in 1.6.0 is something that is likely to work in all other future versions. It's just a regression bug.
https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488

Having that said, I don't have anything against making use of their new way of excluding."}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2019-05-15 13:09:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Yeah. this is a simple enough fix'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-27 10:48:36.000000000', 'message': 'Add networks properties for OS::Nova::Server resource

Since nova api version 2.37,  `networks` entry is required for the server
creation[1]. Plus a heat change[2] in release Rocky removes old workaround.
Therefore instance creation through heat orchestraction template needs
`networks` property of OS::Nova::Server resource in template.

While murano core library not passing this property to heat template makes
it fail to work with Rocky release heat.

The patch passes in `Auto` value to networks object for Instance class.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id34
[2] https://github.com/openstack/heat/commit/3c06347a93343850409a243b3c7e1f11eeb4db3f

Closes-Bug: #1817538

Change-Id: Idef60e2c13e1d4f3ea802504076110ea447d193d
'}]
commit_message:
Add networks properties for OS::Nova::Server resource

Since nova api version 2.37,  `networks` entry is required for the server
creation[1]. Plus a heat change[2] in release Rocky removes old workaround.
Therefore instance creation through heat orchestraction template needs
`networks` property of OS::Nova::Server resource in template.

While murano core library not passing this property to heat template makes
it fail to work with Rocky release heat.

The patch passes in `Auto` value to networks object for Instance class.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id34
[2] https://github.com/openstack/heat/commit/3c06347a93343850409a243b3c7e1f11eeb4db3f

Closes-Bug: #1817538

Change-Id: Idef60e2c13e1d4f3ea802504076110ea447d193d

further work.

[{'created': '2019-05-10 20:31:50.000000000', 'message': 'Bandit test exclusions syntax change

Newer versions of bandit broke their handling of test exclusion
directories. It is now necessary to glob the contents of the directory
rather than just list the base path.

Change-Id: I02fbc02ce8d623b75a7d568ea48bb5e5e6c66b58
'}]
commit_message:
Bandit test exclusions syntax change

Newer versions of bandit broke their handling of test exclusion
directories. It is now necessary to glob the contents of the directory
rather than just list the base path.

Change-Id: I02fbc02ce8d623b75a7d568ea48bb5e5e6c66b58

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-15 14:55:20.000000000', 'message': "Add support for Ceph and Swift storage networks, and improvements to Swift device management and ring generation.

In a deployment that has both Ceph or Swift deployed it can be useful to seperate the network traffic.
This change adds support for dedicated storage networks for both Ceph and Swift. By default, the storage hosts are
attached to the following networks:

* Overcloud admin network
* Internal network
* Storage network
* Storage management network

This adds four additional networks, which can be used to seperate the storage network traffic as follows:

* Ceph storage network (ceph_storage_net_name) is used to carry Ceph storage
  data traffic. Defaults to the storage network (storage_net_name).
* Ceph storage management network (ceph_storage_mgmt_net_name) is used to carry
  storage management traffic. Defaults to the storage management network
  (storage_mgmt_net_name).
* Swift storage network (swift_storage_net_name) is used to carry Swift storage data
  traffic. Defaults to the storage network (storage_net_name).
* Swift storage replication network (swift_storage_replication_net_name) is used to
  carry storage management traffic. Defaults to the storage management network
  (storage_mgmt_net_name).

This change also includes several improvements to Swift device management and ring generation.

The device management and ring generation are now separate, with device management occurring during
'kayobe overcloud host configure', and ring generation during a new command, 'kayobe overcloud swift rings generate'.

For the device management, we now use standard Ansible modules rather than commands for device preparation.
File system labels can be configured for each device individually.

For ring generation, all commands are run on a single host, by default a host in the Swift storage group.
A python script runs in one of the kolla Swift containers, which consumes an autogenerated YAML config file that defines
the layout of the rings.

Change-Id: Iedc7535532d706f02d710de69b422abf2f6fe54c

attached to the following networks:

* Overcloud admin network
* Internal network
* Storage network
* Storage management network

This adds four additional networks, which can be used to seperate the storage network traffic as follows:

* Ceph storage network (ceph_storage_net_name) is used to carry Ceph storage
  data traffic. Defaults to the storage network (storage_net_name).
* Ceph storage management network (ceph_storage_mgmt_net_name) is used to carry
  storage management traffic. Defaults to the storage management network
  (storage_mgmt_net_name).
* Swift storage network (swift_storage_net_name) is used to carry Swift storage data
  traffic. Defaults to the storage network (storage_net_name).
* Swift storage replication network (swift_storage_replication_net_name) is used to
  carry storage management traffic. Defaults to the storage management network
  (storage_mgmt_net_name).

This change also includes several improvements to Swift device management and ring generation.

The device management and ring generation are now separate, with device management occurring during
'kayobe overcloud host configure', and ring generation during a new command, 'kayobe overcloud swift rings generate'.

For the device management, we now use standard Ansible modules rather than commands for device preparation.
File system labels can be configured for each device individually.

For ring generation, all commands are run on a single host, by default a host in the Swift storage group.
A python script runs in one of the kolla Swift containers, which consumes an autogenerated YAML config file that defines
the layout of the rings.

Change-Id: Iedc7535532d706f02d710de69b422abf2f6fe54c

commit_message:
Support for Ceph and Swift storage networks, and improvements to Swift

In a deployment that has both Ceph or Swift deployed it can be useful to seperate the network traffic.
This change adds support for dedicated storage networks for both Ceph and Swift. By default, the storage hosts are
attached to the following networks:

* Overcloud admin network
* Internal network
* Storage network
* Storage management network

This adds four additional networks, which can be used to seperate the storage network traffic as follows:

* Ceph storage network (ceph_storage_net_name) is used to carry Ceph storage
  data traffic. Defaults to the storage network (storage_net_name).
* Ceph storage management network (ceph_storage_mgmt_net_name) is used to carry
  storage management traffic. Defaults to the storage management network
  (storage_mgmt_net_name).
* Swift storage network (swift_storage_net_name) is used to carry Swift storage data
  traffic. Defaults to the storage network (storage_net_name).
* Swift storage replication network (swift_storage_replication_net_name) is used to
  carry storage management traffic. Defaults to the storage management network
  (storage_mgmt_net_name).

This change also includes several improvements to Swift device management and ring generation.

The device management and ring generation are now separate, with device management occurring during
'kayobe overcloud host configure', and ring generation during a new command, 'kayobe overcloud swift rings generate'.

For the device management, we now use standard Ansible modules rather than commands for device preparation.
File system labels can be configured for each device individually.

For ring generation, all commands are run on a single host, by default a host in the Swift storage group.
A python script runs in one of the kolla Swift containers, which consumes an autogenerated YAML config file that defines
the layout of the rings.

Change-Id: Iedc7535532d706f02d710de69b422abf2f6fe54c

commit_message:
Support arbitrarily named Docker drivers

Currently we configure daemon.json to use either devicemapper or overlay
as the storage driver. We should simply pass through whatever is
configured for docker_storage_driver.

Change-Id: Id4423030b5483fe4ecd4f324bc25800e5444fd63
Story: 2005649
Task: 30932

commit_message:
Update py3 runtimes for Train

The official targeted runtimes for Train are 3.6 and 3.7. This updates
jobs and metadata to match the expected runtimes for this cycle.

Change-Id: Iea8bbf8f235e16fd3fe9f0d8651ba8439cbd2d6f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Python3: Fix return type on CooperativeReader.read

CooperativeReader.read() should return bytes. A similar change was
merged in Glance.

Change-Id: Iee3b49235be2af64eac3933e41c7e44fc1a564f4
Closes-Bug: #1818915

commit_message:
Move deeper-indented code to a separate method

This is a follow-up patch of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/656456/
During the review, it turns out that the logic is too deep and
we cannot add more "if" clause. This commit tries to address it.

Change-Id: If133b1bed8ae1a591c4ce34e0a86d6dc1c138c68

condition to the installation step to make ElasticSearch work in
bionic.

ES 1.x, 2.x, 5.x, and 6.x. This change helps devstack users
work with different versions of ElasticSearch.

commit_message:
Remove pkg/elasticsearch.sh

The pkg/elasticsearch.sh is only used by Panko but Panko has
moved the script to its own repository [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/643262/

Change-Id: I0ce40f4299246b68624abd2072c2abce06f1e70b
Signed-off-by: Trinh Nguyen <dangtrinhnt@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Clarify supported SUSE versions

This role only support openSUSE Leap 15, not 42.3, not tumbleweed.
Saying all is confusing and a bad practice. This fixes it, while
ensuring the job is properly defined to test that assertion.

Change-Id: Icd2d1f8f4ee930416c81b9d00fa2e3bc36dac386

[{'created': '2019-05-10 14:08:13.000000000', 'message': "Add integrated coverage

Currently this role doesn't test the integrated jobs.
While this role isn't immediately exercised (the playbook
is skipped), it is good enough to add coverage of the templates,
should we adapt the template in a global fashion.

Additionally, it is a problem to have different jobs
for SUSE support, as we want to use the integrated jobs template
as a mean to get consistent across roles, so that
it's easier to monitor jobs.

commit_message:
Add integrated coverage

Currently this role doesn't test the integrated jobs.
With the dynamic execution of the roles, this role
also tests the telemetry stack in the metal jobs template.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/659064

commit_message:
Add /v2 to mistral api endpoint.

whitout the /v2 openstack cli is not able to list workflows, it always
end in 404.

with /v2 both mistral cli and openstack client can be used.

Change-Id: I80d4fe2441b0a1137aac05fc6ff739cdfefa204d

commit_message:
Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start capping
it there as well.

Change-Id: Ib8da5b64084d5c9b7b7d896d6b7bb7844c0b9e90
Reference: https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

violations. Blacklist this version, but allow newer versions as there is
already a pull request[1] to fix it, and it is expected to be included

commit_message:
Blacklist bandit 1.6.0

There's a regression[0] in bandit 1.6.0 which causes bandit to stop
respecting excluded directories, and our tests throw a bunch of
violations. Blacklist this version, but allow newer versions as there is
already a pull request[1] to fix it, and it is expected to be included
in the next release.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

Change-Id: If2e5f82279981ced89da6fc134a238105be60d8b
Story: 2005676
Task: 30988

The poweroff problem doesn't seem to be the cause of this failure, since it also occurs in successful jobs."}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-04-29 16:42:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

maybe this will help
https://review.opendev.org/656366'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-04-30 07:27:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-04-30 09:06:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck neutron issues?'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-04-30 13:47:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-05-03 10:36:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

The problem with the coreos jobs seem to be even more frustrating than expected.
Checking the logs of the tests, when cirros is loaded, you can see this error:

EXT4-fs (vda1): couldn't mount RDWR because of unsupported optional features (400)
mount: mounting /dev/vda1 on /mnt failed: Invalid argument
failed to mount /dev/vda1

This means that the tools use to format and to mount the partition are not compatible.
The option that is not supported (the 400 code) is apparently the Ext4 Metadata Checksums.
Possible solutions:
- try to update cirros version (we still use 0.3.5 in rocky)
- format the partition without that option
- downgrade the version of coreos used for the testing until a version that has formatting tools compatible with cirros
- change from cirros to something else for testing
- make coreos testing jobs non voting (but they will always fail)
- nuke coreos testing jobs entirely (as in stein and master)"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-05-03 18:09:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> format the partition without that option

Is it possible to do? Does it boil down to backporting https://github.com/openstack/ironic/commit/71f0256b1d951229c22aea2784c0f0711f045e54 further?'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-05-06 08:54:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Dmitry that's exactly what we should exclude!"}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-05-06 14:19:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

did a test and passed:
https://review.opendev.org/656507'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-05-14 09:32:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

this change needs to be abandoned in favor of https://review.opendev.org/658771'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-05-15 11:00:15.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I42bcf5bd05a5cf38444969cdb930052527372bf6

is no longer available, hence all CoreOS jobs fail.

dependencies fail to install without it.

	Dockerfile

commit_message:
Constrain Falcon library to fix unit tests

From the Falcon 2.0.0 release notes:

The deprecated falcon.testing.TestBase class was removed.

Until the tests are updated we can just avoid using this new version.

Story: 2005695
Task: 31016
Change-Id: If1ff5546fa6cedd6c192c009a7cfc99f7998fa2b

subject: Fix user used to upload images
messages:
[{'account_id': 30309, 'date': '2019-05-14 16:26:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-05-14 16:27:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 30309, 'date': '2019-05-15 09:07:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30309, 'date': '2019-05-15 10:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

wrong workflow, pushed to branch instead of master'}]

nova-scheduler uses CONF.default_availabiliy_zone.
However, the required class was not included in scheduler.pp
This patch includes nova::availability_zone class in scheduler.pp.

Signed-off-by: Keigo Noha <knoha@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1824273
Change-Id: Ia94a5d7baf1dd2efc8339475176a1e1c24ad99d0
'}]
commit_message:
Include nova::availability_zone in scheduler.pp

nova-scheduler uses CONF.default_availabiliy_zone.
However, the required class was not included in scheduler.pp
This patch includes nova::availability_zone class in scheduler.pp.

Signed-off-by: Keigo Noha <knoha@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1824273
Change-Id: Ia94a5d7baf1dd2efc8339475176a1e1c24ad99d0

commit_message:
Treat null admin_state_up as False

This patch changes the to_dict function for the API obj, if the user
pass null into admin_state_up to request. We treat it as False.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583413/
Story: 2002927
Task: 22914
Change-Id: Iab79b422983f6b2124837fd9ebe60a85b0516f41

commit_message:
Ignore new ansible-lint pipefail rule

https://github.com/ansible/ansible-lint/pull/199 Introduces a new rule
"shell task uses pipeline without pipefail". This will require refactoring
of several tasks, add ignore to work around CI failures for now.

This patch fixes the ansible-lint rule issue [1] in the
ironic-boot-configuration validation to unblock the gate.

[1] - Don't compare to empty string (602)

Change-Id: Ie39e3d1e4e1c8258e2a1db6296686c697b97eb9e
(cherry picked from commit 53f6bcd4d11109d36ab479db373da6d6a22bab39)
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-14 08:52:14.000000000', 'message': "Fix Jinja2's default filter usage

The default() filter provided by Jinja2 treats the special class
Undefined differently from False-y Python values. By default, default()
will only return its first argument if the prior expression evaluates to
Undefined. The second boolean parameter asks the function to also accept
Python False-y values as undefined and return the default value.

In these two roles, the variables retrieved from configuration files may
not be present and the default function won't work since these variables
will be 'Undefined' or set to an empty string.

Change-Id: Ib2cb1f94c71409477eb18d55f160d57dc5850ead
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-05-14 09:42:08.000000000', 'message': "Fix Jinja2's default filter usage

The default() filter provided by Jinja2 treats the special class
Undefined differently from False-y Python values. By default, default()
will only return its first argument if the prior expression evaluates to
Undefined. The second boolean parameter asks the function to also accept
Python False-y values as undefined and return the default value.

In these two roles, the variables retrieved from configuration files may
not be present and the default function won't work since these variables
will be 'Undefined' or set to an empty string.

Change-Id: Ib2cb1f94c71409477eb18d55f160d57dc5850ead
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Jinja2's default filter usage

The default() filter provided by Jinja2 treats the special class
Undefined differently from False-y Python values. By default, default()
will only return its first argument if the prior expression evaluates to
Undefined. The second boolean parameter asks the function to also accept
Python False-y values as undefined and return the default value.

In these two roles, the variables retrieved from configuration files may
not be present and the default function won't work since these variables
will be 'Undefined' or set to an empty string.

Change-Id: Ib2cb1f94c71409477eb18d55f160d57dc5850ead
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2019-05-14 11:27:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix kolla-docker possible undefined variable

It is possible to reference undefined variable in kolla-docker module if
DockerWorker object initialization fail, so the current behaviour will
crash the playbook with the unwanted error message :

UnboundLocalError: local variable 'dw' referenced before assignment

Change-Id: Ic8d26b11f93255220888b5406f8ab4a6f81736c2
Closes-Bug: #1819361
(cherry picked from commit 3bb4c199817c8aa4ecd4ae684bd28f84933fb14d)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix kolla-docker possible undefined variable

It is possible to reference undefined variable in kolla-docker module if
DockerWorker object initialization fail, so the current behaviour will
crash the playbook with the unwanted error message :

UnboundLocalError: local variable 'dw' referenced before assignment

Change-Id: Ic8d26b11f93255220888b5406f8ab4a6f81736c2
Closes-Bug: #1819361
(cherry picked from commit 3bb4c199817c8aa4ecd4ae684bd28f84933fb14d)

commit_message:
[wip] rhel8 continuing work

* remove yum-minimal parts; not required for using upstream image

* mount the xfs file-system for extraction as read-only.  vaguely
  based on explaination in [1] and the fact we only read the image
  data into a tar, so can ignore this.

    XFS (dm-1): Superblock has unknown read-only compatible features (0x4) enabled.

* Use the redhat system python as the dib-python version.  dib was
  ahead of it's time making an abstracted python interpreter for
  system work ;) the system python should work for running the various
  dib element scripts.

Redhat-Bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1700253

[1] https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/247550/unmountable-xfs-filesystem

Change-Id: Ife6405d5edc147439c661802db9b2f6cfec740c7

commit_message:
show inspection callback url in error messages

We have seen issues in misconfigured systems where messages from IPA
to ironic-inspector fail with 404 or other standard HTTP error
codes. Although there is an info message reporting the URL, the error
messages do not include the URL of the service IPA is trying to talk
to, which makes debugging the configuration difficult. This change
adds the URL to the error already being reported to improve that
situation.

Change-Id: Ib092ac690d29c385c0564c086ad2fec3df0fb2e0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Disable limit if affinity(anti)/same(different)host is requested

When max_placement_results is less than the total number of nodes in
a deployment it may not be possible to use the affinity, anti-affinity,
same host or different host filters as there is no guarantee
for placement to return the expected hosts under such situations. This
patch disables the max_placement_results parameter when nova queries
placement for ``GET /allocation_candidates`` if the
request_spec.scheduler_hints containts any of group, same_host or
different_host keys.

Change-Id: Ia2d5f80b6db59a8f6da03344aeaa6aa599407672
Closes-Bug: #1827628

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-09 10:11:22.000000000', 'message': "NetApp: Return all iSCSI targets-portals

NetApp iSCSI drivers use discovery mode for multipathing, which means
that we'll fail to attach a volume if the IP provided for the discovery
is not accessible from the host.

Something similar would happen when using singlepath, as we are only
trying to connect to one target/portal.

This patch changes NetApp drivers so the return target_iqns,
target_portals, and target_luns parameters whenever there are more than
one option.

Closes-Bug: #1806398
Change-Id: If6b5ad23c899032dbf7535ed91251cbfe54a223a
(cherry picked from commit c65869626594522231709d9c90a30524a1f0d18c)

commit_message:
NetApp: Return all iSCSI targets-portals

NetApp iSCSI drivers use discovery mode for multipathing, which means
that we'll fail to attach a volume if the IP provided for the discovery
is not accessible from the host.

Something similar would happen when using singlepath, as we are only
trying to connect to one target/portal.

This patch changes NetApp drivers so the return target_iqns,
target_portals, and target_luns parameters whenever there are more than
one option.

Changes to be committed:
modified:   cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/eseries/library.py
As part eseries driver  code is still in the tree.  Need to propose
an additional patch to the stable branch, notice that patch
would not be in master, even though both have the same issue.

Closes-Bug: #1806398
Change-Id: If6b5ad23c899032dbf7535ed91251cbfe54a223a
(cherry picked from commit c65869626594522231709d9c90a30524a1f0d18c)
(cherry picked from commit dee7292b0849e3d6e28941c8d203dfd39692f0c6)

commit_message:
Add sort_keys retrieving function

This patch provides a tool function to retrieve valid sort keys
from `attr_info` dict. And it's necessary prerequisite to fix
bug-1659175.

Related-bug: #1659175
Change-Id: I5ef7a0730122011f5ef18c1b4e2c0bfe82ed585b

commit_message:
Use megabyte granularity for image extra space

I want to use the new --image-extra-size flag[1] but my use-case
calls for megabyte granularity of this value. Rather than adding
60% to an 800MB image, maybe I only want to add 100 or 200MB, etc.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/655127/

Change-Id: I8fb9685d60ebb1260d5efcf03c5c23c561c24384

commit_message:
Update test coverage for openSUSE/-minimal to 15.0

Use openSUSE 15.0 as default, which is the latest released stable
openSUSE release. Switch to https for accessing download.o.org
as encrypted transfers should be used by default.

Remove leftovers for definitely unmaintained openSUSE 13.x images
and split into old/new leap style versioning scheme for clarity.

Change-Id: Iab129eeee2b1a2563f0f0d2cb17bbad57c068e38

commit_message:
scope for datamodel

This patch adds a scope to the datamodel, which only gets the VMs
 of the specified nodes, and no longer gets all VMs from nova.

Implements: blueprint scope-for-watcher-datamodel
Change-Id: Ic4659d1f18af181203439a8bf1b38805ff34c309

subject: Skip _exclude_nested_providers() if not nested
messages:
[{'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-05-14 07:47:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-05-14 09:33:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-05-14 12:09:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-05-14 15:31:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

This is a clear win, great work Tetsuro.

I have concerns about backporting, but they don't have to hold up this patch.

Are we really thinking to backport this to rocky? That would entail first making a stable-only patch in the nova repo in stein. That said, is there an alternative for folks running rocky? Is it possible to run extracted stein+ placement against rocky everything-else? (I don't see why it wouldn't be from an API point of view, but I'm not sure what barriers would exist in terms of upper constraints and distros and configuration...)

Conclusion of above musings: particularly considering how self-contained this fix is, making stable-only patches in nova seems like a reasonable plan."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-05-14 17:48:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks for doing this. I especially like that the data manipulation method has been moved to the data manipulation python files, out of the handlers.

Re backporting: if people want it, we should considering doing it, but only if there is demand. The impact of OVO on performance is significant enough that if people have performance issues they are best served by upgrading to extracted placement, even if they continue to run older nova/neutron. They will need to be intelligent about migrating their data, but we have at least one person who is already doing this:

* throughout the day after: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-placement/%23openstack-placement.2019-05-03.log.html#t2019-05-03T16:41:47
* http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-placement/%23openstack-placement.2019-05-10.log.html#t2019-05-10T17:51:03'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-05-15 02:00:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit 28a341acfd77fe34dc8948ddb663439f67dea7d6'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-14 07:47:36.000000000', 'message': 'Skip _exclude_nested_providers() if not nested

In rocky cycle, 'GET /allocation_candidates' started to be aware of
nested providers from microversion 1.29, namely, it can have multiple
allocations from multiple resource providers in the same tree in the
allocation requests.

To keep the behavior of microversion before 1.29, it added a filters
to exculde nested providers being unaware of the nested architecture.
However that function "_exclude_nested_providers()" is very heavy
and is executed even if there is no nested provider in the environment
when microversion < 1.29.

This patch changes it to skip it if there is no nested provider.

Since _exclude_nested_providers() should be done before limitting
the candidates, this patch also moves it from hander file to the
deeper layer.

Change-Id: I4efdc65395e69a6d33fba927018d003cce26fa68
Story: 2005669
Task: 30980

commit_message:
Skip _exclude_nested_providers() if not nested

In rocky cycle, 'GET /allocation_candidates' started to be aware of
nested providers from microversion 1.29, namely, it can have multiple
allocations from multiple resource providers in the same tree in the
allocation requests.

To keep the behavior of microversion before 1.29, it added a filters
to exculde nested providers being unaware of the nested architecture.
However that function "_exclude_nested_providers()" is very heavy
and is executed even if there is no nested provider in the environment
when microversion < 1.29.

This patch changes it to skip it if there is no nested provider.

Since _exclude_nested_providers() should be done before limitting
the candidates, this patch also moves it from hander file to the
deeper layer.

Change-Id: I4efdc65395e69a6d33fba927018d003cce26fa68
Story: 2005669
Task: 30980

commit_message:
Ensure that log message with non-ascii code does not raise exception

This may cause the looping task to freeze.

Change-Id: Ibf1ace8f0c45a56738432028c8125154c5aa3c15

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-25 08:22:35.000000000', 'message': "Eventlet monkey patching should be as early as possible

We were seeing infinite recursion opening an ssl socket when running
various combinations of python3, eventlet, and urllib3. It is not
clear exactly what combination of versions are affected, but for
background there is an example of this issue documented here:

https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/371

The immediate cause in nova's case was that we were calling
eventlet.monkey_patch() after importing urllib3. Specifically, change
Ie7bf5d012e2ccbcd63c262ddaf739782afcdaf56 introduced the
nova.utils.monkey_patch() method to make monkey patching common
between WSGI and non-WSGI services. Unfortunately, before executing
this method you must first import nova.utils, which imports a large
number of modules itself. Anything imported (transitively) by
nova.utils would therefore be imported before monkey patching, which
included urllib3. This triggers the infinite recursion problem
described above if you have an affected combination of library
versions.

While this specific issue may eventually be worked around or fixed in
eventlet or urllib3, it remains true that eventlet best practises are
to monkey patch as early as possible, which we were not doing. To
avoid this and hopefully future similar issues, this change ensures
that monkey patching happens as early as possible, and only a minimum
number of modules are imported first.

This change fixes monkey patching for both non-wsgi and wsgi callers:

* Non-WSGI services (nova/cmd)

  This is fixed by using the new monkey_patch module, which has minimal
  dependencies.

* WSGI services (nova/api/openstack)

  This is fixed both by using the new monkey_patch module, and by moving
  the patching point up one level so that it is done before importing
  anything in nova/api/openstack/__init__.py.

  This move causes issues for some external tools which load this path
  from nova and now monkey patch where they previously did not. However,
  it is unfortunately unavoidable to enable monkey patching for the wsgi
  entry point without major restructuring. This change includes a
  workaround for sphinx to avoid this issue.

This change has been through several iterations. I started with what
seemed like the simplest and most obvious change, and moved on as I
discovered more interactions which broke. It is clear that eventlet
monkey patching is extremely fragile, especially when done implicitly at
module load time as we do. I would advocate a code restructure to
improve this situation, but I think the time would be better spent
removing the eventlet dependency entirely.

Co-authored-by: Lee Yarwood <lyarwood@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #1808975
Closes-Bug: #1808951
Change-Id: Id46e76666b553a10ec4654d4418a9884975b5b95
(cherry picked from commit 3c5e2b0e9fac985294a949852bb8c83d4ed77e04)
"}]
commit_message:
Eventlet monkey patching should be as early as possible

We were seeing infinite recursion opening an ssl socket when running
various combinations of python3, eventlet, and urllib3. It is not
clear exactly what combination of versions are affected, but for
background there is an example of this issue documented here:

https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/371

The immediate cause in nova's case was that we were calling
eventlet.monkey_patch() after importing urllib3. Specifically, change
Ie7bf5d012e2ccbcd63c262ddaf739782afcdaf56 introduced the
nova.utils.monkey_patch() method to make monkey patching common
between WSGI and non-WSGI services. Unfortunately, before executing
this method you must first import nova.utils, which imports a large
number of modules itself. Anything imported (transitively) by
nova.utils would therefore be imported before monkey patching, which
included urllib3. This triggers the infinite recursion problem
described above if you have an affected combination of library
versions.

While this specific issue may eventually be worked around or fixed in
eventlet or urllib3, it remains true that eventlet best practises are
to monkey patch as early as possible, which we were not doing. To
avoid this and hopefully future similar issues, this change ensures
that monkey patching happens as early as possible, and only a minimum
number of modules are imported first.

This change fixes monkey patching for both non-wsgi and wsgi callers:

* Non-WSGI services (nova/cmd)

  This is fixed by using the new monkey_patch module, which has minimal
  dependencies.

* WSGI services (nova/api/openstack)

  This is fixed both by using the new monkey_patch module, and by moving
  the patching point up one level so that it is done before importing
  anything in nova/api/openstack/__init__.py.

  This move causes issues for some external tools which load this path
  from nova and now monkey patch where they previously did not. However,
  it is unfortunately unavoidable to enable monkey patching for the wsgi
  entry point without major restructuring. This change includes a
  workaround for sphinx to avoid this issue.

This change has been through several iterations. I started with what
seemed like the simplest and most obvious change, and moved on as I
discovered more interactions which broke. It is clear that eventlet
monkey patching is extremely fragile, especially when done implicitly at
module load time as we do. I would advocate a code restructure to
improve this situation, but I think the time would be better spent
removing the eventlet dependency entirely.

Co-authored-by: Lee Yarwood <lyarwood@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #1808975
Closes-Bug: #1808951
Change-Id: Id46e76666b553a10ec4654d4418a9884975b5b95
(cherry picked from commit 3c5e2b0e9fac985294a949852bb8c83d4ed77e04)

commit_message:
Performance improvement for non-udp health checks

When no UDP listeners are present, skip the UDP health-check code
branch, which prevents expensive and unnecessary DB calls.
Also optimise the UDP health-check code so it only fetches information
for relevant listeners.

Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I7fde54084b39c1d0529cfb0bcfb79697d63ea6ae

commit_message:
Uncap Bandit

This was capped due to a problem with how it processed exclusions.
Once that problem is fixed we want to uncap it and exlude only the
specific versions that are broken.

Change-Id: I4f367de91842f9062a22de15273eac5010bee954

commit_message:
Cap to sphinx 2.0.0 on Python 2.7

Sphinx 2.0.0 dropped Python 2.7 support. This is aligned with

project.

commit_message:
Add cinder extras storops library

This patch adds the cinder extras storops library needed by the
Dell EMC VNX driver

active: yes
good code: seems good
py3: yes
license compat: yes
packaged: eh?
covered by other libs: no
needed by: cinder
managed by openstack: no

Change-Id: I227bf514d15e301224a01252c5f5f784f040ad34

commit_message:
Don't wait for metadata service unnecessarily

Before neutron-server transitions a port to ACTIVE, it'll wait
until the metadata service has been provisioned on that hypervisor.
If the port doesn't belong to any IPv4 subnet with DHCP enabled,
there's no need to wait for it.

Change-Id: Iba3969e43c76ca07fe840b84d8f81f34bc7e5cd6
Closes-Bug: #1828585
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

Nova has deprecated RamFilter and DiskFilter[0] since they are not

commit_message:
Remove deprecated scheduler filters

Nova has deprecated RamFilter and DiskFilter[0] since they are not
used after Ocata. The placement service relies on placement for these
filtering decisions now.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/596502/

Change-Id: Ic94c473b81197d22d8dc2e641c23f0d8687fda4b

commit_message:
Clarify supported SUSE versions

This role only support openSUSE Leap 15, not 42.3, not tumbleweed.
Saying all is confusing and a bad practice. This fixes it, while
ensuring the job is properly defined to test that assertion.

Change-Id: I7a84474a2c2359c4c6fa9de1118659498e35cc6c

commit_message:
Clarify supported SUSE versions

This role only support openSUSE Leap 15, not 42.3, not tumbleweed.
Saying all is confusing and a bad practice. This fixes it, while
ensuring the job is properly defined to test that assertion.

Change-Id: I494d754ae23071e56502d3e99fa5ba603a09e5e3

Currently this role doesn't test the integrated jobs.

This is a problem because:

commit_message:
Clarify supported SUSE versions

This role only support openSUSE Leap 15, not 42.3, not tumbleweed.
Saying all is confusing and a bad practice. This fixes it, while
ensuring the job is properly defined to test that assertion.

Change-Id: I679939edd56149a2aed29228e5215648956c60da

commit_message:
exc_filters: fix deadlock detection for MariaDB/Galera cluster

MariasDB/Galera cluster server produces an error like:

(1213, u'Deadlock: wsrep aborted transaction')

which is currently not detected properly and, thus, not retried.

Change-Id: Ifb4a81d50e490e734e12986e51efd6bd3c339c31
Signed-off-by: Pierre-Samuel Le Stang <pierre-samuel.le-stang@corp.ovh.com>
(cherry picked from commit ae227eb3b9adb430cf6aa5a4f46f846e964fff91)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-09 12:01:37.000000000', 'message': "Expose innodb_lock_wait_timeout via hieradata.

Along the same lines of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/603996/.
This commits expoxes one more knob to the operators, allowing them
to tweak the value of innodb_lock_wait_timeout (default = 50).
From upstream docs:

~~~
Time in seconds that an InnoDB transaction waits for an InnoDB
row lock (not table lock) before giving up with the error
ERROR 1205 (HY000): Lock wait timeout exceeded; try restarting transaction.
When this occurs, the statement (not transaction) is rolled back.
~~~

As for the other parameters it defaults to 'undef' so to keep the
default value of 50.

Change-Id: Ic2e1666ad39762caf9bf68272fdb00ee42658bb8
(cherry picked from commit 10216c7865f0c8aa64173c9fa8ff934c3edbf375)
"}]
commit_message:
Expose innodb_lock_wait_timeout via hieradata.

Along the same lines of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/603996/.
This commits expoxes one more knob to the operators, allowing them
to tweak the value of innodb_lock_wait_timeout (default = 50).
From upstream docs:

~~~
Time in seconds that an InnoDB transaction waits for an InnoDB
row lock (not table lock) before giving up with the error
ERROR 1205 (HY000): Lock wait timeout exceeded; try restarting transaction.
When this occurs, the statement (not transaction) is rolled back.
~~~

As for the other parameters it defaults to 'undef' so to keep the
default value of 50.

Change-Id: Ic2e1666ad39762caf9bf68272fdb00ee42658bb8
(cherry picked from commit 10216c7865f0c8aa64173c9fa8ff934c3edbf375)

[{'created': '2019-05-14 14:18:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix requirements job

The requirements job was broken by https://review.opendev.org/657890
adding a cap on Sphinx on Python 2. Since no docs jobs should be
running on Python 2, limit the dependency to Python >=3.4 to keep the
requirements check happy.

Change-Id: Ic059b43f87ad9cdafb4dccd48a5bcf785d5fa868
'}]
commit_message:
Fix requirements job

The requirements job was broken by https://review.opendev.org/657890
adding a cap on Sphinx on Python 2. Since no docs jobs should be
running on Python 2, limit the dependency to Python >=3.4 to keep the
requirements check happy.

Change-Id: Ic059b43f87ad9cdafb4dccd48a5bcf785d5fa868

"raw_input()" deprecated in Python3

Built-in function "raw_input()" is deprecated in favor of "input()" [1].

[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3111/

Change-Id: I31c4c59373a2ad04987da3daffb3eed50916a6db
Closes-Bug: #1823321

[{'created': '2019-05-14 12:32:37.000000000', 'message': 'Can bandit below 1.6.0 version.

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how to exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until

commit_message:
Cap bandit below 1.6.0 version and update sphinx and limit monotonic.

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how to exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
bandit has has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so need to start capping it
there as well.

Limit monotonic to python < 3.3 and reflect the changes to
openstack/requirements introduced
in change Ib8c1bf08f5fa7463911602b0df19315907c81e04.

Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I4c2a19fae55e8cfea2d5ae9603a1fb086b5db1bf

[{'account_id': 28956, 'date': '2018-11-08 17:58:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-11-09 15:55:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

You see that there is an openstack-tox-py36 job running here; it ran on this patch.  Are you saying that without this patch that job is not actually using py36?  Or is this something else?

Setting -1 just for the clarification, otherwise I have no concrete objection at this time.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-11-27 04:29:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

envlist just defines the default environments.
tox 2.3.2 or above knows 'py36' as environment,
so it is not required to run py36 UT in our gate.
I don't see much value to update 'envlist' whenever we support a new python version."}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2019-05-14 20:19:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This patch has been stale for awhile now. Moving it to abandoned to clean-up the queue. If this patch is still active, please push an update to it.'}]

commit_message:
Modify the description of network_ip_availability parameters

The 'total_ips' and 'used_ips' means not only the number of IP in
the network, but also the number of IP in the subnet.

Change-Id: I274e37d6945640d5ad7b9144da4f8fae68c8bb65

commit_message:
Port binding levels extension presented

New extension for representing hierarchical port binding info.
This is the first patch set for neutron-lib.
Another one for neutron is required
where this definition will be used.
Including unit tests.

Change-Id: I3a844711487b57c3ea93156884adea9aed2398dc
Partial-Bug: 1756705

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-02 21:58:31.000000000', 'message': "Remove list of required extensions

In preparation for the feature that enables support for any
network topology, it's no longer necessary to depend on these
extensions.

Change-Id: I4503293be4275e09f1598ab677b324de3c3710d4
Related-bug: 1690438
"}, {'created': '2017-08-02 22:00:46.000000000', 'message': "Remove list of required extensions for auto-allocated-topology extension

In preparation for the feature that enables support for any
network topology, it's no longer necessary to depend on these
extensions. No need for shims or API flags, as the dependency
will seamlessly detected at runtime rather than server startup.

Related-bug: 1690438
