commit_message:
Remove list of required extensions for auto-allocated-topology extension

In preparation for the feature that enables support for any
network topology, it's no longer necessary to depend on these
extensions. No need for shims or API flags, as the dependency
will seamlessly detected at runtime rather than server startup.

Related-bug: 1690438

Change-Id: I4503293be4275e09f1598ab677b324de3c3710d4

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 20:02:12.000000000', 'message': "update convert_to_protocol converter for secgroup

As part of rehoming the neutron security group extension's API def, it
became apparent it would be nice to use the generic convert_to_protocol
converter rather than introducing a new 1-off security group specific
one for convert_protocol [1].

This patch updates convert_to_protocol as follows:
- The value of data can now be an integer and is converted to a str.
- If data is a str, it's checked against the keys of IP_PROTOCOL_MAP
rather than IPTABLES_PROTOCOL_MAP.
- If data is a valid integer, it'll also be returned as a str.

FWaaS seems to be the only consumer of this converter [2], so we should
make sure someone from that group reviews this patch and agrees.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/extensions/securitygroup.py#L146
[2] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=convert_to_protocol

Change-Id: I23328a7c3fc66a243bfd976d3180e58249b12b88

commit_message:
converters and validators for secgroup api-def

This patch adds the API converters and validators that will be needed
by the security group api def [1]. This includes a few new validators
and converters as well as a minor change to the existing
convert_protocol. Unit tests as well as a release note are also
included.

[1] I9466274a5236645471c1d0aab5c692b4728b8c6c

Change-Id: I23328a7c3fc66a243bfd976d3180e58249b12b88

commit_message:
Mark tenant_id as invisible for some resources

According to the documents [1], the resources flavors,
service_profiles and metering label rules don't have attribute
'tenant_id' in their responses. Therefore, this attribute should
be marked as invisible in apidef.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/liberty/
    neutron-flavor-framework.html

Change-Id: Id93530645821aec66de0ef9dfebf29af59076a98
Related-Bug: #1773827

Hi, Li Zhouzhou, can you add more information about how to appear this bug, and the error messsages in the launchpad?'}, {'account_id': 27295, 'date': '2018-06-19 12:27:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Hi, Li Zhouzhou, can you add more information about how to appear
 > this bug, and the error messsages in the launchpad?

This patch is used to 'net-create', when we create a network which supports vlan transparent, we should add a parameter 'vlan-transparent'. But now, when we create it, the server will responds a "Unrecognized attribute(s) 'vlan_transparent'" error.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-06-19 12:59:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

As per the comments in the bug, it appears this is really an RFE and needs to first be approved by the drivers team... Also we shouldn't be adding new attributes directly to existing resources; they should be introduced as a new extension."}, {'account_id': 19644, 'date': '2018-06-19 13:06:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

some clear now.
you should use "openstack network create" command. Is it also has this issue, right?'}, {'account_id': 27295, 'date': '2018-06-19 13:23:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> some clear now.
 > you should use "openstack network create" command. Is it also has
 > this issue, right?

"openstack network create" command is work. But, I will code RFE " Implement vlan transparent for openvswitch ML2 driver", link is https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1604222, so I hope neutron command can support the adding of 'vlan-transparent'. And, its can update dynamically.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-06-22 13:18:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

As per slaweq's comments in the associated bug, this RFE appears to need more details and should be approved before we start coding and reviewing here."}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-06-22 14:00:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We already have this extension:

1) This is the spec approved and implemented back in Kilo: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/kilo/nfv-vlan-trunks.html

2) This is the neutron-lib definition: https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/api/definitions/vlantransparent.py

3) This is the DB layer code in Neutron: https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/vlantransparent_db.py

4) This is the extension code in Neutron: https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/extensions/vlantransparent.py

5) And this is the ML2 plugin using the extension: https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py#L126'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2019-05-14 20:18:56.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This patch has been stale for awhile now. Moving it to abandoned to clean-up the queue. If this patch is still active, please push an update to it.'}]

commit_message:
support vlan transparent in neutron network

Now, if we use 'neutron net-create' to create a network, which
didn't work, because neutron api can't resolve the parameter
'vlan-transparent'. So we should add 'vlan_tranparent' in
network attributes.

Change-Id: I2f83408f1b2fde6932af7d8a40c5bff283578a8b
Closes-bug: #1777585

What do you all think about me proposing a "mini spec" to neutron-specs to discuss this issue; or is that overkill?


Just want to make sure we are using the proper approach to discuss this issue so we can try to hammer it out in Rocky.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-03-26 15:56:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> What do you all think about me proposing a "mini spec" to
 > neutron-specs to discuss this issue; or is that overkill?
 > 
 > 
 > Just want to make sure we are using the proper approach to discuss
 > this issue so we can try to hammer it out in Rocky.

This will be a good topic to discuss at the team meeting?'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-03-27 17:23:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

If we decide to go with a static approach, IMO this implies we have to allow even non-stadium networking projects to add their "extended resources" to the static definition... Frankly I don't see a problem with this; it's basically what we are doing today by ensuring public extensions doc all their resources in their RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP (and submap). Moreover it follows our API ref approach; if these definitions are dynamic someone probably has to go dig through them so we can properly/completely doc their API reference.




Certainly I can see arguments against the static approach. If we wanted a dynamic approach perhaps we could consider allowing consumers to register their resources via stevedore entry points and then we could dyanmically discover them from neutron-lib.



ATM I'm personally leaning towards the static approach, but I won't loose sleep either way.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2019-05-14 20:18:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This patch has been stale for awhile now. Moving it to abandoned to clean-up the queue. If this patch is still active, please push an update to it.'}]

commit_message:
rehome quotasv2 api def

This patch rehomes the quotas extension's API definition. As the current
extension code in neutron builds the resource attributes dynamically,
this patch extracts them into the static RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP. As
indicated in the release note, this means if new resources are added to
quotas, they need to be updated here in the API def as well as in the
API reference docs. Finally note that the quota API becomes more
strict only accepting the attributes defined in the API def (see
unit test change in sample consumption patch).

For sample consumption see
I1f315ca08beba57ab4a0bc59bd5f015620d17a6b

NeutronCoreInputNeeded

Change-Id: Idfedfb3b79e13d8fed3c5f4ca4739849d49e9043

subject: introduce VIF_DETAILS_OVS_INTERFACEID
messages:
[{'account_id': 1894, 'date': '2017-12-22 12:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2017-12-23 01:25:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don´t understand why we need to make this change now. Even in the original patchset that you point, port_id is used. If nova has the port id from the response body it got from Neutron, why do we have to put it in vif_details? Can you provide more background? I will also need to see that this is being accepted on the Nova side: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/529831

I also -1ed the corresponding Neutron patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/529829'}, {'account_id': 1894, 'date': '2017-12-25 04:46:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for reviewing, Miguel.

I assume this change was intended by nova team, but no one took care this in neutron so far. So, I'm trying to finish this series of change. I just found wired parameter 'ovs_interfaceid' in nova codebase and figured out the intention in gerrit.

This change will make sure nova and neutron know the right/same interface ID by exchanging the ID explicitly rather than sticking with the implicit rule, which is to use neutron port ID as ovs interface ID. This change also gives freedom of naming rule of ovs interface ID to new neutron plugin developer.

The 'ovs_interfaceid' is now set to have the same sting of neutron port id, so there is no problem in current codebase. If this change doesn't make sense, I'll send a nova patch to delete 'ovs_interfaceid'.

The reasons to put this parameter in 'vif_details' are 1) the parameter is only for ovs plugin/agent(s), and 2) this parameter is part of vif information, especially vif plugging. So, i think it should be in 'vif_details'. I may misunderstand the data structure in portbinding API, let me know if there is better place to put this parameter in."}, {'account_id': 1894, 'date': '2018-01-09 06:58:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-01-09 13:24:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Please also include a release note.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2019-05-14 20:18:31.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This patch has been stale for awhile now. Moving it to abandoned to clean-up the queue. If this patch is still active, please push an update to it.'}]

commit_message:
introduce VIF_DETAILS_OVS_INTERFACEID

This definition is needed to make neutron pass right OVS interface id
to nova via the portbinding API.

Currently, nova set neutron's port uuid as OVS interface id in libvirt
xml, so that neutron agent can identify new added interface is for
which logical port of neutron. That is an implicit rule and needed to
be taken care in both of nova and neutron.

Passing OVS interface id from neutron to nova is intended in [1]. And
this patch defines new name of parameter which will be added in the
vif_details of the portbinding API.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19121/

Change-Id: I7d00f5ffe0b3504dcfd5d0be73f16c50b8b583d6
Signed-off-by: Ryota MIBU <r-mibu@cq.jp.nec.com>

[{'created': '2019-05-10 03:37:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Pep8 bandit error

Make bandit runs with 1.6.0

bandit 1.6.0 was released today:
https://pypi.org/project/bandit/1.6.0/

And is uncapped in test-requirements:
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.service/blob/master/test-requirements.txt#L21

And not in upper-constraints:
https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/upper-constraints.txt

The -x option for bandit changed in 1.6.0 and now
supports glob patterns so use that to correctly
exclude test code from bandit scans.

Seems we should exclude test code from bandit scans.

Change-Id: Ie3dd6c91c733b85c233213a1c6343009d5f34766

commit_message:
Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start marking
it there as well.

Co-Authored-By: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <openstack@nemebean.com>

Reference:
https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

Related to Ibaa10b092b262e49435d35f093906bb75dc9762f

Change-Id: Ie3dd6c91c733b85c233213a1c6343009d5f34766

Fluentd makes rsyslog to send the logs to fluentd locally.
This configuration was create within the puppet-tripleo,
mounting the /etc/rsyslog.d/ directory on the fluentd
container. This generates an issue when is deployed on
RHEL BZ #1701726.

This patch aim to fix it.
 - The /etc/rsyslog.d directory is no longer mounted
 on the fluentd container.
 - The rsyslog configuration was moved to the host_prep_tasks.

Depends-On: I388180dc991926ff30f8bbc556f61447152f8dc9

commit_message:
Modified the way fluentd configures rsyslog

Fluentd makes rsyslog to send the logs to fluentd locally.
This configuration was create within the puppet-tripleo,
mounting the /etc/rsyslog.d/ directory on the fluentd
container. This generates an issue when is deployed on
RHEL BZ #1701726.

This patch aim to fix it.
 - The /etc/rsyslog.d directory is no longer mounted
 on the fluentd container.
 - The rsyslog configuration was moved to the host_prep_tasks.

Depends-On: I388180dc991926ff30f8bbc556f61447152f8dc9
Change-Id: Iae610832c12d63bde1eb507ba4bb89f2e3cfa24b

commit_message:
Ignore traits with a COMPUTE_ prefix in wait for placement

Traits with a COMPUTE_ prefix are for signalling driver capabilities in
nova. These may be expected to change over time, so ignore them all.

Change-Id: I8cb667bc456e88abad0283970e69bb1cdb1cd249
Story: 2005675
Task: 30986

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-13 20:10:13.000000000', 'message': 'Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start capping
it there as well.

Change-Id: If86c82e0f4a519baca664af79352846c4af9a01c
Reference: https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489
'}]
commit_message:
Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start capping
it there as well.

Change-Id: If86c82e0f4a519baca664af79352846c4af9a01c
Reference: https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein
messages:
[{'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-03-08 21:31:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Waiting on requirements stable/stein branch.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2019-03-08 21:40:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-03-20 14:02:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> Waiting on requirements stable/stein branch.

Hey Michael - check the commit message for updates from how this was done in the past. There are now redirects in place where there is no longer a need to wait. This can be merged now and requests for stable/stein will just get defaulted to current master until the requirements stable branch is actually created.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-03-21 03:00:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This was made before https://review.openstack.org/#/c/643387/ was merged so it used the old style URL for constraints.

It should now be https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/stein which will currently point to http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt?h=master until requirements branches when it will switch to http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt?h=stable/stein auto-magically :)

I'll edit ASAP."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-03-21 03:17:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-03-21 13:53:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-05-14 17:37:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-08 21:19:13.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ia74cda879eceebaa915cb09c0e71ec6b91010bab
"}, {'created': '2019-03-21 03:17:29.000000000', 'message': 'Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia74cda879eceebaa915cb09c0e71ec6b91010bab
'}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia74cda879eceebaa915cb09c0e71ec6b91010bab

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-14 12:21:14.000000000', 'message': 'Add curl to the default heat image

curl was apparently forgotten in the refactor to have images built
in zuul automatically.

This is a problem, as the heat image is used in glance to fetch
the CirrOS image, which would fail if curl is absent.

Change-Id: Ia1a84766865ea5c4e4a26516c9e8faa2e0daf9b2
'}]
commit_message:
Add curl to the default heat image

curl was apparently forgotten in the refactor to have images built
in zuul automatically.

This is a problem, as the heat image is used in glance to fetch
the CirrOS image, which would fail if curl is absent.

Change-Id: Ia1a84766865ea5c4e4a26516c9e8faa2e0daf9b2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-10 09:53:55.000000000', 'message': "Fix bandit errors

Bandit 1.6.0 changes the behavior of the '-x' option so that it now
supports glob patterns. Update our tox file to use to correctly exclude
test code from bandit scans. This requires bumping our minimum bandit
version.

As an aside, changing the behavior of an option like this in a minor
version if bad form :(

Change-Id: Ica9cb392c3a594911a8765456521cca7503af710
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-05-13 12:42:23.000000000', 'message': "Fix bandit errors

Bandit 1.6.0 changes the behavior of the '-x' option so that it now
supports glob patterns. Update our tox file to use to correctly exclude
test code from bandit scans. This requires bumping our minimum bandit
version.

As an aside, changing the behavior of an option like this in a minor

commit_message:
Fix bandit errors

Bandit 1.6.0 changes the behavior of the '-x' option so that it now
supports glob patterns. Update our tox file to use to correctly exclude
test code from bandit scans. This requires bumping our minimum bandit
version.

As an aside, changing the behavior of an option like this in a minor
version if bad form :(

Change-Id: Ica9cb392c3a594911a8765456521cca7503af710
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add safety check output to the linters output

Currently a safety check failure is ignored, the output
is just for informational purposes. it reports known
security issues with the versions in upper-constraints.txt
so that we can determine a corrective action.

Change-Id: Ib8191602f47641eb047ebe5972ffa92bcfd08de4

commit_message:
Let fluentd not create /etc/rsyslog.d/fluentd.conf file

Currently, when fluentd is configured to listen to syslogs, Fluentd
configures itself and also rsyslog creating the file
/etc/rsyslog.d/fluentd.conf. This generates an issue when
is deployed on RHEL BZ #1701726.

To avoid this issue, a fluentd_managed_rsyslog parameter is added so
fluentd can be configured to create the file or not.

Change-Id: I388180dc991926ff30f8bbc556f61447152f8dc9
(cherry picked from commit a87f8be7ef9a4be791cccb0018ebf9b3814b162b)

commit_message:
[DNM] Rename nova_placement_service_password

To merge the recent addition of placement into
the integrated repo, we need to make both os_nova
and os_placement use the same password. This patch
renames nova_placement_service_password to
placement_service_password.

Change-Id: I5e1bfb16d77ef3b2b7703ab8bc3efbbdbaf67068

commit_message:
Allow NovaNfs parameters to be role specific

Currently, TripleO does not support to have an NFS backend as Nova Ephemeral storage on
selected roles. An admin should be allowed to create Compute role(s) for InstanceHA
having NFS shared storage used then by selected workloads while leaving the majority of
the workloads on standard compute nodes without InstanceHA and shared storage.

Closes-Bug: 1823712

Change-Id: I2702a022565a130ab339d165cb2252ad67d1162e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-09 12:01:50.000000000', 'message': "Expose innodb_lock_wait_timeout via hieradata.

Along the same lines of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/603996/.
This commits expoxes one more knob to the operators, allowing them
to tweak the value of innodb_lock_wait_timeout (default = 50).
From upstream docs:

~~~
Time in seconds that an InnoDB transaction waits for an InnoDB
row lock (not table lock) before giving up with the error
ERROR 1205 (HY000): Lock wait timeout exceeded; try restarting transaction.
When this occurs, the statement (not transaction) is rolled back.
~~~

As for the other parameters it defaults to 'undef' so to keep the
default value of 50.

Change-Id: Ic2e1666ad39762caf9bf68272fdb00ee42658bb8
(cherry picked from commit 10216c7865f0c8aa64173c9fa8ff934c3edbf375)
"}]
commit_message:
Expose innodb_lock_wait_timeout via hieradata.

Along the same lines of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/603996/.
This commits expoxes one more knob to the operators, allowing them
to tweak the value of innodb_lock_wait_timeout (default = 50).
From upstream docs:

~~~
Time in seconds that an InnoDB transaction waits for an InnoDB
row lock (not table lock) before giving up with the error
ERROR 1205 (HY000): Lock wait timeout exceeded; try restarting transaction.
When this occurs, the statement (not transaction) is rolled back.
~~~

As for the other parameters it defaults to 'undef' so to keep the
default value of 50.

Change-Id: Ic2e1666ad39762caf9bf68272fdb00ee42658bb8
(cherry picked from commit 10216c7865f0c8aa64173c9fa8ff934c3edbf375)

commit_message:
[Trivial fix]Remove unnecessary slash

This is to:
1. Remove the unncessary slash when the line doesn't exceed the length
   of 79, to make the code more readable.
2. Replace backslashes with Python's implied line continuation according
   to https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/#maximum-line-length

Change-Id: I989507020d5bb7f216d374575cebe005d27225da

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-13 15:44:33.000000000', 'message': 'Set upper-constraint for scikit-learn

We capped scikit-learn for Python 2 compatibility in change
If558f184c959e4b63b56dec3ca1571d1034cfe5c, but upper-constraints were
not set. When scikit-learn is a dependency of a dependency, like with
taskflow, this can result in consuming projects still getting the newer
version under py2 runtimes. This adds the upper-constraint so the cap
will be enforced.

Change-Id: If205849b1248c5295d087b747c9703d0c317810e
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Set upper-constraint for scikit-learn

We capped scikit-learn for Python 2 compatibility in change
If558f184c959e4b63b56dec3ca1571d1034cfe5c, but upper-constraints were
not set. When scikit-learn is a dependency of a dependency, like with
taskflow, this can result in consuming projects still getting the newer
version under py2 runtimes. This adds the upper-constraint so the cap
will be enforced.

Change-Id: If205849b1248c5295d087b747c9703d0c317810e
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Updating alarm for different alarm types

This patch will reflect the value of "type"
parameter during parsing of "aodh update"
command which add the functionality to update
the alarm between different alarm types.

Change-Id: I5ca9a9a28c509a6767c7d77796edae9a5e8ce0dc
Closes-Bug: #1757994

commit_message:
Remove deprecated configuration options

This patch removes the following config options:

- use_user_token
- admin_user
- admin_password
- admin_tenant_name
- auth_url
- auth_strategy
- auth_region

Change-Id: I5b75724b827f24ce2a603b73b22e8bdb2094e2e3

commit_message:
Data Service CLI commands

Added the following commands to work with Data Service API in
manila:

- data-copy-from-share
- data-erase
- data-copy-get-progress
- data-copy-cancel

TODO:
- Unit tests
- Functional tests
- Reno

Implements: blueprint data-service-api

Change-Id: I4fe0928ccd80aa4d0abac22b0d358accf412d115

commit_message:
Add Fetcher documentation

Add a Fetcher documentation section in admin/configuration/
with details about configuration of all currently available fetchers.
This patch covers options of the new Prometheus fetcher too.

Change-Id: Id1dae663aeddbd0564ea798654ce339ef4a3c9f9
Story: 2005427
Task: 30460

commit_message:
[tripleo] final releases for pike

This is a procedural review to tag a final release for each
deliverables.

It's possible that the release isn't needed (for example if
there are no code changes sine the previous release, sadly
that's non-trivial to detect en masse).

If you are the PTL or release liaison for this team please +1
this review if it is ready or -1 and take over the review to
correct mistakes.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/658877/
Change-Id: I9216306aef6974b9275efeebf32c31631ffa63a6

commit_message:
Do not install README.rst and LICENSE

Both files are already in the sdist tarball. There is no need to
install the files into (possibly) wrong locations for different distros.

Change-Id: I0c6e985d08acb96043b4cbb59fe964f5cd67480a

i need to step through this carefully but i think we are ching things that we dont intend to here there orderign of calls does not imideatly appear to be unambigously correct so i think we need to validate this change carfully to make sure it has no impact on other code paths.

the presence of the vifs field in the migration data object for example is used to signel that both the sorce and dest support multiple port binding but i do not belive that will work as inteded with the current code as we would be unconditionally setting it in 
check_can_live_migrate_destination'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-26 23:58:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

so yes this is causing non sriov migration to explode

so i have tested this patch chain with the neutron patch and it appears to work localy

this is the local.conf i used on the controler
for other reviewers that want to replicate this.
http://paste.openstack.org/show/736118/

i have live migrated macvtap based sriov vms and ovs backed vms and both seam to work correctly.

i still think we need to make some changes but this seams to be functional'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2018-12-02 08:02:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-12-02 09:53:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(12 comments)

I commend you for trying to get this done. I don't see any major issues with the code, though it is overly complex compared to if we managed PCI devices like other resources in the system (e.g. CPU, RAM, local disk, etc).

If we managed PCI devices using the same system we do for CPU, memory and local disk, then we could do the resource *claim* in the scheduler's claim_resources() call and then the binding/assignment process could proceed on the destination host without worrying about any resource exhaustion...

-jay"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-04-04 11:40:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-26 17:39:25.000000000', 'message': 'SR-IOV Live migration indirect port support

This patch, builds on previous patches and enables
Live migration with SR-IOV indirect ports.

Conductor Changes:
- Allow live migration only with VIF related PCI devices to
  allow a more predictable migration as currently live migration
  with "other" PCI devices will either fail or succeed without
  properlly claiming PCI resources on the destination node.

- update the migrating VIF with the correct profile when binding the
  ports on the destination host.

Compute Changes:
- Create VIFMigrateData for all VIFs in
  check_can_live_migrate_destination()

- For every VIF that contains a PCI device in its profile
  claim a PCI device on the destination node using the matching
  InstancePCIRequest of the instance being migrated.

- Update the relevant VIFMigrateData profile with the newly
  claimed PCI device.

- Free PCI devices on source and allocate on destination upon
  a successfull migration or free claimed PCI devices on destination
  upon failure.

NeutronV2 Changes:
- Dont update binding profile if migration type is live-migration
  as the profile was already updated when an inactive port binding was
  created when bind_ports_to_host() was called from conductor.

  Note: This builds on multiple ports binding API.

Change-Id: I734cc01dce13f9e75a16639faf890ddb1661b7eb
Partial-Implement: blueprint libvirt-neutron-sriov-livemigration

'}, {'created': '2018-12-02 16:00:22.000000000', 'message': 'SR-IOV Live migration indirect port support

This patch, builds on previous patches and enables
Live migration with SR-IOV indirect ports.

Conductor Changes:
- Allow live migration only with VIF related PCI devices to
  allow a more predictable migration as currently live migration
  with "other" PCI devices will either fail or succeed without
  properlly claiming PCI resources on the destination node.

- Add a check to allow live migration with VIF related PCI allocation
  only when neutron supports multiple ports binding API extention
  and compute nodes are up to date with this code by checking the
  computes Service version.

- update the migrating VIF with the correct profile when binding the
  ports on the destination host.

Compute Changes:
- Create VIFMigrateData for all VIFs in
  check_can_live_migrate_destination()

- For every VIF that contains a PCI device in its profile
  claim a PCI device on the destination node using the matching
  InstancePCIRequest of the instance being migrated.

- Update the relevant VIFMigrateData profile with the newly
  claimed PCI device.

- Free PCI devices on source and allocate on destination upon
  a successfull migration or free claimed PCI devices on destination
  upon failure.

NeutronV2 Changes:
- Dont update binding profile with PCI devices if migration type is
  live-migration as the profile was already updated when an inactive
  port binding was created during bind_ports_to_host() call
  from conductor.

  Note: This builds on multiple ports binding API.

Change-Id: I734cc01dce13f9e75a16639faf890ddb1661b7eb
Partial-Implement: blueprint libvirt-neutron-sriov-livemigration

This patch, builds on previous patches and enables
Live migration with SR-IOV indirect ports.

Conductor Changes:
- Allow live migration only with VIF related PCI devices to
  allow a more predictable migration as currently live migration
  with "other" PCI devices will either fail or succeed without
  properlly claiming PCI resources on the destination node.

- Add a check to allow live migration with VIF related PCI allocation
  only when neutron supports multiple ports binding API extention
  and compute nodes are up to date with this code by checking the
  computes Service version.

- update the migrating VIF with the correct profile when binding the
  ports on the destination host.

Compute Changes:
- Create VIFMigrateData for all VIFs in
  check_can_live_migrate_destination()

- For every VIF that contains a PCI device in its profile
  claim a PCI device on the destination node using the matching
  InstancePCIRequest of the instance being migrated.

- Update the relevant VIFMigrateData profile with the newly
  claimed PCI device.

- Free PCI devices on source and allocate on destination upon
  a successfull migration or free claimed PCI devices on destination
  upon failure.

NeutronV2 Changes:
- Dont update binding profile with PCI devices if migration type is
  live-migration as the profile was already updated when an inactive
  port binding was created during bind_ports_to_host() call
  from conductor.

  Note: This builds on multiple ports binding API.

Change-Id: I734cc01dce13f9e75a16639faf890ddb1661b7eb
Partial-Implement: blueprint libvirt-neutron-sriov-livemigration

'}, {'created': '2019-01-14 19:41:58.000000000', 'message': "SR-IOV Live migration indirect port support

This patch, builds on previous patches and enables
Live migration with SR-IOV indirect ports.

Conductor Changes:
- Allow live migration only with VIF related PCI devices to allow
  properlly claiming PCI resources on the destination node.
  Today, apart of resource claiming libvirt prevents live migration
  with PCI passthorugh devices.

- Add a check to allow live migration with VIF related PCI allocation
  only when neutron supports multiple ports binding API extention
  and compute nodes are up to date with this code by checking the
  computes Service version.
  Prior to this check migration would have either:
      - Failed with instance running on the source node.
      - Failed with two VMs booted on both source and destination
        nodes, VM state is set to migrating, duplicate MACs on
        source and destination node and improper PCI resource claiming.
        This scenario is observed in the case of macVtap port type and
        neutron does not support multiple port binding API extention.
  With very little, non user friendly information in the log.

- update the migrating VIF with the correct profile when binding the
  ports on the destination host, this will allow proper binding against
  the destination host and ensure VIF will be plugged correctly by Nova.

Compute Changes:
- Create VIFMigrateData for all VIFs in
  check_can_live_migrate_destination()

- For every VIF that contains a PCI device in its profile
  claim a PCI device on the destination node using the matching
  InstancePCIRequest of the instance being migrated.

- Update the relevant VIFMigrateData profile with the newly
  claimed PCI device.

- Free PCI devices on source and allocate on destination upon
  a successful migration or free claimed PCI devices on destination
  upon failure.

NeutronV2 Changes:
- Don't update binding profile with PCI devices if migration type is
  live-migration as the profile was already updated when an inactive
  port binding was created during bind_ports_to_host() call
  from conductor.

  Note: This builds on multiple ports binding API.

Change-Id: I734cc01dce13f9e75a16639faf890ddb1661b7eb
Partial-Implement: blueprint libvirt-neutron-sriov-livemigration

"}, {'created': '2019-01-16 17:10:29.000000000', 'message': "SR-IOV Live migration indirect port support

This patch, builds on previous patches and enables
Live migration with SR-IOV indirect ports.

Prior to this change migration would have either:
  - Failed with instance running on the source node.
  - Failed with two VMs booted on both source and destination
    nodes, VM state is set to migrating, duplicate MACs on
    source and destination node and improper PCI resource claiming.
    This scenario is observed in the case of macVtap port type and
    neutron does not support multiple port binding API extention.
With very little, non user friendly information in the log.

Conductor Changes:
- Allow live migration only with VIF related PCI devices to allow
  properly claiming PCI resources on the destination node.
  Today, even with resource claiming libvirt prevents live migration
  with PCI passthorugh devices.

- Add a check to allow live migration with VIF related PCI allocation
  only when neutron supports multiple ports binding API extention
  and compute nodes are up to date.
  Prior to this check migration would have either:
      - Failed with instance running on the source node.
      - Failed with two VMs booted on both source and destination
        nodes, VM state is set to migrating, duplicate MACs on
        source and destination node and improper PCI resource claiming.
        This scenario is observed in the case of macVtap port type and
        neutron does not support multiple port binding API extention.
  With very little, non user friendly information in the log.

- update the migrating VIF with the correct profile when binding the
  ports on the destination host, this will allow proper binding against
  the destination host and ensure VIF will be plugged correctly by Nova.

Compute Changes:
- Create VIFMigrateData for all VIFs in
  check_can_live_migrate_destination()

- For every VIF that contains a PCI device in its profile
  claim a PCI device on the destination node using the matching
  InstancePCIRequest of the instance being migrated.

- Update the relevant VIFMigrateData profile with the newly
  claimed PCI device.

- Free PCI devices on source and allocate on destination upon
  a successful migration or free claimed PCI devices on destination
  upon failure.

NeutronV2 Changes:
- Don't update binding profile with PCI devices if migration type is
  live-migration as the profile was already updated when an inactive
  port binding was created during bind_ports_to_host() call
  from conductor.

  Note: This builds on multiple ports binding API.

Change-Id: I734cc01dce13f9e75a16639faf890ddb1661b7eb
Partial-Implement: blueprint libvirt-neutron-sriov-livemigration

"}, {'created': '2019-02-05 23:27:05.000000000', 'message': "SR-IOV Live migration indirect port support

This patch, builds on previous patches and enables
Live migration with SR-IOV indirect ports.

Prior to this change migration would have either:
  - Failed with instance running on the source node.
  - Failed with two VMs booted on both source and destination
    nodes, VM state is set to migrating, duplicate MACs on
    source and destination node and improper PCI resource claiming.
    This scenario is observed in the case of macVtap port type and
    neutron does not support multiple port binding API extention.
With very little, non user friendly information in the log.

Conductor Changes:
- Allow live migration only with VIF related PCI devices to allow
  properly claiming PCI resources on the destination node.
  Today, even with resource claiming libvirt prevents live migration
  with PCI passthorugh devices.

- Add a check to allow live migration with VIF related PCI allocation
  only when neutron supports multiple ports binding API extention
  and compute nodes are up to date.

- update the migrating VIF with the correct profile when binding the
  ports on the destination host, this will allow proper binding against
  the destination host and ensure VIF will be plugged correctly by Nova.

Compute Changes:
- Create VIFMigrateData for all VIFs in
  check_can_live_migrate_destination()

- For every VIF that contains a PCI device in its profile
  claim a PCI device on the destination node using the matching
  InstancePCIRequest of the instance being migrated.

- Update the relevant VIFMigrateData profile with the newly
  claimed PCI device.

- Free PCI devices on source and allocate on destination upon
  a successful migration or free claimed PCI devices on destination
  upon failure.

NeutronV2 Changes:
- Don't update binding profile with PCI devices if migration type is
  live-migration as the profile was already updated when an inactive
  port binding was created during bind_ports_to_host() call
  from conductor.

  Note: This builds on multiple ports binding API.

Change-Id: I734cc01dce13f9e75a16639faf890ddb1661b7eb
Partial-Implement: blueprint libvirt-neutron-sriov-livemigration
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/620123/

    This scenario is observed in the case of macvtap port type and
    neutron does not support multiple port binding API extension.
    With very little, non user friendly information in the log.

Conductor Changes:
- Allow live migration only with VIF related PCI devices to allow
  properly claiming PCI resources on the destination node.
  With this change live migration with generic flavor based
  PCI passthrough devices will not be supported due to libvirt and
  qemu constraint.

- Add a check to allow live migration with VIF related PCI allocation
  only when neutron supports multiple ports binding API extension
  and compute nodes are up to date.

- update the migrating VIF with the correct profile when binding the
  ports on the destination host, this will allow proper binding against
  the destination host and ensure VIF will be plugged correctly by Nova.

Compute Changes:
- Create VIFMigrateData for all VIFs in
  check_can_live_migrate_destination()

- For every VIF that contains a PCI device in its profile
  claim a PCI device on the destination node using the matching
  InstancePCIRequest of the instance being migrated.

- Update the relevant VIFMigrateData profile with the newly
  claimed PCI device.

- Free PCI devices on source and allocate on destination upon
  a successful migration or free claimed PCI devices on destination
  upon failure.

NeutronV2 Changes:
- Don't update binding profile with PCI devices if migration type is
  live-migration as the profile was already updated when an inactive
  port binding was created during bind_ports_to_host() call
  from conductor.

  Note: This builds on multiple ports binding API.

Change-Id: I734cc01dce13f9e75a16639faf890ddb1661b7eb

commit_message:
SR-IOV Live migration indirect port support

This patch, builds on previous patches and enables
Live migration with SR-IOV indirect ports.

Prior to this change migration would have either:
  - Failed with instance running on the source node.
  - Failed with two VMs booted on both source and destination
    nodes, VM state is set to migrating, duplicate MACs on
    source and destination node and improper PCI resource claiming.
    This scenario is observed in the case of macvtap port type and
    neutron does not support multiple port binding API extension.
    With very little, non user friendly information in the log.

Conductor Changes:
- Allow live migration only with VIF related PCI devices to allow
  properly claiming PCI resources on the destination node.
  With this change live migration with generic flavor based
  PCI passthrough devices will not be supported due to libvirt and
  qemu constraint.

- Add a check to allow live migration with VIF related PCI allocation
  only when neutron supports multiple ports binding API extension
  and compute nodes are up to date.

- update the migrating VIF with the correct profile when binding the
  ports on the destination host, this will allow proper binding against
  the destination host and ensure VIF will be plugged correctly by Nova.

Compute Changes:
- Create VIFMigrateData for all VIFs in
  check_can_live_migrate_destination()

- For every VIF that contains a PCI device in its profile
  claim a PCI device on the destination node using the matching
  InstancePCIRequest of the instance being migrated.

- Update the relevant VIFMigrateData profile with the newly
  claimed PCI device.

- Free PCI devices on source and allocate on destination upon
  a successful migration or free claimed PCI devices on destination
  upon failure.

NeutronV2 Changes:
- Don't update binding profile with PCI devices if migration type is
  live-migration as the profile was already updated when an inactive
  port binding was created during bind_ports_to_host() call
  from conductor.

  Note: This builds on multiple ports binding API.

Change-Id: I734cc01dce13f9e75a16639faf890ddb1661b7eb
Partial-Implement: blueprint libvirt-neutron-sriov-livemigration

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-09 12:00:47.000000000', 'message': "Expose innodb_lock_wait_timeout via hieradata.

Along the same lines of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/603996/.
This commits expoxes one more knob to the operators, allowing them
to tweak the value of innodb_lock_wait_timeout (default = 50).
From upstream docs:

~~~
Time in seconds that an InnoDB transaction waits for an InnoDB
row lock (not table lock) before giving up with the error
ERROR 1205 (HY000): Lock wait timeout exceeded; try restarting transaction.
When this occurs, the statement (not transaction) is rolled back.
~~~

As for the other parameters it defaults to 'undef' so to keep the
default value of 50.

Change-Id: Ic2e1666ad39762caf9bf68272fdb00ee42658bb8
(cherry picked from commit 10216c7865f0c8aa64173c9fa8ff934c3edbf375)
"}]
commit_message:
Expose innodb_lock_wait_timeout via hieradata.

Along the same lines of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/603996/.
This commits expoxes one more knob to the operators, allowing them
to tweak the value of innodb_lock_wait_timeout (default = 50).
From upstream docs:

~~~
Time in seconds that an InnoDB transaction waits for an InnoDB
row lock (not table lock) before giving up with the error
ERROR 1205 (HY000): Lock wait timeout exceeded; try restarting transaction.
When this occurs, the statement (not transaction) is rolled back.
~~~

As for the other parameters it defaults to 'undef' so to keep the
default value of 50.

Change-Id: Ic2e1666ad39762caf9bf68272fdb00ee42658bb8
(cherry picked from commit 10216c7865f0c8aa64173c9fa8ff934c3edbf375)

commit_message:
NUMA aware vswitches

Set configuration parameters to enable
NUMA affinity for vswitches.

The related nova changes are done in change:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/564440/

Depends-On: Id7c2f0b53c8871ff47a836ec4c324c8cce430b79
Change-Id: Ia8fd65a75bc732087128e9e32ba72b2491423898

commit_message:
Add storage section to Cloudkitty config

A v2 influxdb backend storage is also available. Its API is considered
stable but its implementation may still evolve.

https://docs.openstack.org/cloudkitty/latest/admin/configuration/configuration.html#setup-the-database-and-storage-backend

Change-Id: I80a14263feb659138987412c83e30ff2f467446a

commit_message:
Update json module to jsonutils

oslo project provide jsonutils, and blazar use it in many place,
this PS to update the remained json moudule to oslo jsonutils for
consistency.

commit_message:
Add support code for multicast DNS service discovery

To simplify standalone configuration, we need an ability for IPA
to discovery ironic and ironic-inspector on the local network.
This change adds the support code for using multicast DNS (RFC 6762)
with DNS service discovery (RFC 6763) to publish and discover
OpenStack services as proposed in the API SIG guideline
https://review.opendev.org/651222.

Change-Id: Iaf3422331238884412ce608c0667de7891945f98
Story: #2005393
Task: #30432

commit_message:
Update json module to jsonutils

1. oslo project provide jsonutils, and barbican use it in many place[1],
this PS to update the remained json moudule to oslo jsonutils for
consistency.
2. update the primary jsonutils to use alias json

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/barbican/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=jsonutils&type=

Change-Id: I958a711db17bb1aa86fc4cd23c00cec185b84ab2

commit_message:
Add a base resource for v2 API endpoints

This adds a base resource for all v2 API endpoints. For now, this
base resource returns a 403 Forbidden HTTP error in case a user
tries to execute a forbidden action, but it may be extended in the
future.

Change-Id: I7814c0432e8da591b1f971091619a257c4184191

(1 comment)

I still don't think this is testing what we want though. What we _want_ to test is that 'JSONFormatter' can be used with logging.config.fileConfig, as seen at [1]. This doesn't address that, right?

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534658/4/oslo_log/tests/unit/test_log.py@1473"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-05-17 16:30:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

For that test wouldn't we just want to ensure that the formatter was actually configured? We don't need it to be an end-to-end functional test of the formatter if it's a test of the fileConfig code."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-05-30 13:07:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

> > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > I still don't think this is testing what we want though. What we

 > 
 > For that test wouldn't we just want to ensure that the formatter
 > was actually configured? We don't need it to be an end-to-end
 > functional test of the formatter if it's a test of the fileConfig

I'm not sure. All I know is that if I revert the patch that this is supposed to be testing, the tests still pass. That suggests this isn't doing what we want, right?

As an aside, we need to migrate to stestr. I saw 'db type could not be determined' messages for the first time in a while here"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-05-14 12:55:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

calls out to other endpoints.

Change-Id: I45beef2521e8168d98482709a4d0196b6859db5c
'}]
commit_message:
Inform Neutron gateway if certs change

As with nova-compute the neutron-gateway needs to know if the CA
changes otherwise certificate validation will fail when it makes
calls out to other endpoints.

Change-Id: I45beef2521e8168d98482709a4d0196b6859db5c

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-13 11:37:11.000000000', 'message': "Fix bandit errors

Bandit 1.6.0 changes the behavior of the '-x' option so that it now
supports glob patterns. Update our tox file to use to correctly exclude
test code from bandit scans. This requires bumping our minimum bandit version.

As an aside, changing the behavior of an option like this in a minor
version if bad form :(

Also a bandit version bump is proposed to openstack/requirements:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/658767/

Change-Id: I34a53bf6b9389af8530f5806841814cc035eae99
"}, {'created': '2019-05-13 13:21:59.000000000', 'message': "Fix bandit errors

Bandit 1.6.0 changes the behavior of the '-x' option so that it now
supports glob patterns. Update our tox file to use to correctly exclude
test code from bandit scans. This requires bumping our minimum bandit
version.

As an aside, changing the behavior of an option like this in a minor
version if bad form :(

Change-Id: I34a53bf6b9389af8530f5806841814cc035eae99
"}, {'created': '2019-05-14 09:04:59.000000000', 'message': 'Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start capping
it there as well.

Change-Id: I34a53bf6b9389af8530f5806841814cc035eae99
'}, {'created': '2019-05-14 11:00:57.000000000', 'message': 'Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx and jsonschema requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start capping
it there as well.

Remove the jsonschema >3.0.0 version.

Co-Authored-By: zhurong <aaronzhu1121@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I34a53bf6b9389af8530f5806841814cc035eae99
'}]
commit_message:
Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx and jsonschema requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start capping
it there as well.

Remove the jsonschema >3.0.0 version.

Co-Authored-By: zhurong <aaronzhu1121@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I34a53bf6b9389af8530f5806841814cc035eae99

commit_message:
Setup losf functional test with saio setup

And fix some minor issues we found to run.

- Change  rpc_test.go to import statsd/v2 rather than statsd.
- Set LD_LIBRARY_PATH to /usr/local/lib when starting the index server.

Co-Authored-By: Alexandre Lécuyer <alexandre.lecuyer@corp.ovh.com>

Change-Id: I4f6711934c0c350da831578cac3e6b6896ea892b

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

commit_message:
Microversion 2.73: Support adding the reason behind a server lock

This patch adds a new parameter ``--reason`` to ``nova lock``
command and ``--locked`` filtering/sorting parameter to
``nova list`` command. This can help users to provide a reason
when locking the server and to filter/sort instances based on their
locked or value from 2.73 microversion.

Implements blueprint add-locked-reason
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/648662/

Change-Id: I438e6db2dd5000ba388d0a0f1c8ab74b96b47a71

Missing record in host_mappings table causes nova to print
"Unable to find service" DEBUG message (see below) and

The patch resets mapped field to 0 if host got changed because
new host may not have mapping record yet.

Closes-Bug: #1825876

Missing record in host_mappings table causes nova to print
"Unable to find service" DEBUG message (see below) and
ignore baremetal compute.
The patch resets mapped field to 0 if host got changed because

Change-Id: Ide9933fc58119d6a87f66bb83e88f1693bb68d5f

'}]
commit_message:
Fix disappearing ironic hypervisors after rebuilding hashring

Missing record in host_mappings table causes nova to print
"Unable to find service" DEBUG message (see below) and
ignore baremetal compute.
The patch resets mapped field to 0 if host got changed because
new host may not have mapping record yet.

Change-Id: Ide9933fc58119d6a87f66bb83e88f1693bb68d5f
Closes-Bug: #1825876

commit_message:
Try to find partition 3 times

The partx may return 0 code in case of failure. Thus
utils.execute could not detect failure and 2+ call attempts
are note performed.
Proposed changes:
* Execute partx->udevadm->lsblk call chain 3 times until
partition is found.
* Add constant sleep between iterations

Change-Id: Ibb024875f817658fcbb8ed93279e28c3bc527c3e
Closes-Bug: #1736386

commit_message:
API microversion 2.69: Handles Down Cells

This patch explicitly points out the change needed while
forming the detailed lists for servers. In those cases
where the server response for ``openstack server list``
has the flavor and image keys missing for the instances
in the down cell, the servers will be skipped from being
processed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/591657/
Related to blueprint handling-down-cell
Change-Id: Ibcfe9febdc45db1cb86c6e88f65976feceb01c02

commit_message:
Update git.openstack.org to opendev.org

The project infrastructure is now hosted at opendev.org.

Kayobe projects have been moved from the openstack/ namespace to x/.

commit_message:
Fix kolla-docker possible undefined variable

It is possible to reference undefined variable in kolla-docker module if
DockerWorker object initialization fail, so the current behaviour will
crash the playbook with the unwanted error message :

UnboundLocalError: local variable 'dw' referenced before assignment

Change-Id: Ic8d26b11f93255220888b5406f8ab4a6f81736c2
Closes-Bug: #1819361

I think you could go back to PS4 but you need to then match global-requirements:

sphinx!=1.6.6,!=1.6.7 # BSD

But you'd also need the python_version constraint like in upper-constraints:

Sphinx===1.8.5;python_version=='2.7'
Sphinx===2.0.1;python_version=='3.4'
Sphinx===2.0.1;python_version=='3.5'
Sphinx===2.0.1;python_version=='3.6'

So I think that means something like this:

sphinx!=1.6.6,!=1.6.7,<2.0;python_version=='2.7'
sphinx!=1.6.6,!=1.6.7;python_version=='3'

But I'm not entirely sure. We could ask Matthew Thode from the requirements team for help."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-10 18:16:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

So the issue is not the docs job, it's the py27 job, right? I think this is probably going about things the wrong way - there should be a doc/requirements for building docs, and the sphinx stuff goes there, see how novaclient does that:

https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/d68f26ab95032b6880d18ad6c04e4d7c09b63629#diff-46507bcc13aee955f6fe861c30ea5444

https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/9d8eda8b824d2cd106e4bb75dae6dcd4399ca343#diff-46507bcc13aee955f6fe861c30ea5444"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-10 18:16:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I don't actually have problems running watcherclient py27 tests though, how do you recreate the issue you're seeing?"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-10 18:17:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

I don't understand why we need this."}, {'account_id': 29911, 'date': '2019-05-10 19:38:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> I think you could go back to PS4 but you need to then match

 > But I'm not entirely sure. We could ask Matthew Thode from the
 > requirements team for help.

When I specify ;python_version=='2.7' the build job fails saying the the marker should match '' IE empty because of the upper constraints. I do not see how we can make it so the py27 job will succeed without capping the py3 requirements to sphinx < 2.0.0

I will try your recommendation but I am pretty sure that will also fail maybe it is indeed best to ask Matthew"}, {'account_id': 29911, 'date': '2019-05-10 19:40:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-10 20:41:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

But why do we actually need to change anything? What issue are you hitting? I was able to run both the py27 and docs jobs successfully for this repo without any changes.'}, {'account_id': 29911, 'date': '2019-05-11 06:16:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Because the python 2.7 build job failed see: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/657375/'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-11 22:28:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Hmm, that seems like an issue with upper-constraints not being respected during that test run.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-11 22:49:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

I think this is what we need: https://review.opendev.org/658567'}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2019-05-13 06:57:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

This is a sake of argument about what doing a black conversion, limited
to 79 characters in length, would look like. It adds a check to the pep8
check to make sure the code conforms, and it still runs pep8, not for
the formatting, but because there are pyflakes checks that do static
analysis of actual things and those are still useful.

commit_message:
DNM Format code with black and gate on it

This is a sake of argument about what doing a black conversion, limited
to 79 characters in length, would look like. It adds a check to the pep8
check to make sure the code conforms, and it still runs pep8, not for
the formatting, but because there are pyflakes checks that do static
analysis of actual things and those are still useful.

This is obviously a GIANT patch and will auto-conflict with every patch
in flight.

Change-Id: I188a5c5de28ec3ce9809c28bfefd80f98cfd1e7c

[{'created': '2019-05-13 23:13:23.000000000', 'message': "Set locale to english

oslo.vmware library does not need to emit localized messages from
vCenter. Explicitly setting the locale to 'en' during session
establishment to avoid UnicodeDecodeError while handling non-
english vCenter messages.

Change-Id: Ifb26a7832c15af3ed3227c94131fe0b22579e889
"}]
commit_message:
Set locale to english

oslo.vmware library does not need to emit localized messages from
vCenter. Explicitly setting the locale to 'en' during session
establishment to avoid UnicodeDecodeError while handling non-
english vCenter messages.

Change-Id: Ifb26a7832c15af3ed3227c94131fe0b22579e889

commit_message:
Don't swallow ValueError

This would mask any failure and make it harder to figure out what is
going wrong.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I29e2a435b46b59ccd296238633ef08927384feeb

commit_message:
Pass kwargs to exception to get better format of error message

If we do not pass kwargs to exception, the parameter will be deemed
as message and will be displayed directly. This is to pass kwargs to
MultipleHostsFound and UnsupportedResourceType, to get better format
of error message.

Change-Id: Ib40ee68249b34f3e83100c5da8d30e13ff820dfa

commit_message:
Blacklist bandit 1.6.0

There's a regression[0] in bandit 1.6.0 which causes bandit to stop
respecting excluded directories, and our tests throw a bunch of
violations. Blacklist this version, but allow newer versions as there is
already a pull request[1] to fix it, and I expect it will be included in
the next release.

Also fix doc/requirements to match sphinx version with global ones

[0] PyCQA/bandit#488
[1] PyCQA/bandit#489

Change-Id: Ibc6f989ab4edde9c5815b4abe10b63c6bba222b5

[{'created': '2019-05-11 01:29:57.000000000', 'message': 'Add nosec to skip bandit check

Bandit is flagging one of the lines in unit test as a security

Change-Id: I36feb93bc23ba5ef0cb497859140bb5f962f2bee
'}]
commit_message:
Add nosec to skip bandit check

Bandit is flagging one of the lines in unit test as a security
issue which is false positive. Adding nosec to skip that line.

Change-Id: I36feb93bc23ba5ef0cb497859140bb5f962f2bee

This is the same code for v1 and v2.

While we're in there, add checksum verification for when download
is used with an output file.

subject: Blacklist bandit 1.6.0
messages:
[{'account_id': 27809, 'date': '2019-05-14 10:00:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-05-14 10:00:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 27809, 'date': '2019-05-14 10:05:11.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Currently this role doesn't test the integrated jobs.

This is a problem because:
* This role can possibly break the integrated, because
  we don't test it.
* For SUSE support, we want to use the integrated jobs as
  using this template will bring consistency across role, and
  will be easier to monitor jobs for SUSE.

Change-Id: I42ba26551903653b4696ae805f0a7a82f2b45348

commit_message:
Add integrated coverage

Currently this role doesn't test the integrated jobs.

This is a problem because:
* This role can possibly break the integrated, because
  we don't test it.
* For SUSE support, we want to use the integrated jobs as
  using this template will bring consistency across role, and
  will be easier to monitor jobs for SUSE.

Change-Id: I42ba26551903653b4696ae805f0a7a82f2b45348

commit_message:
Add integrated coverage

Currently this role doesn't test the integrated jobs.

This is a problem because:
* This role can possibly break the integrated, because
  we don't test it.
* For SUSE support, we want to use the integrated jobs as
  using this template will bring consistency across role, and
  will be easier to monitor jobs for SUSE.

Change-Id: Iba57faf186aa2114ecc71b3c9b2dac0e9e4a2c35

commit_message:
Import legacy-rally-dsvm-zaqar-zaqar

Import job legacy-rally-dsvm-zaqar-zaqar and rename according to
Zuul v3 naming conventions.

Remove branches condition, there's an implicit one, this is not
needed.

This is a partial backport.

Change-Id: Ic18f76fef2b139a3edefecc6004846b11ee7653e
(cherry picked from commit d7dc1bc750aed121bfc50fc999ff03e96cfd2deb)

commit_message:
Make test_hotplug_nic test first check the IP

The test doesn't take into account that the interface can
already be associated with the IP address, configured by
NetworkManager. Therefore the review adds a check if the
IP is already set.

Change-Id: I4eede97c041b44d9a7bb754e5ccc1ebb194a2e4b

commit_message:
Use standard py37 jobs, remove py35

Use the new openstack-python37-jobs template for python 3.7 testing and
remove python 3.5 tested on Xenial, we switch now completely to Bionic
testing with Python 3.6 and 3.7.

Change-Id: I51ac3d6207653c52bebe004fcb866c66ebdd4dae

subject: Fix horizon start a new dashboard
messages:
[{'account_id': 27277, 'date': '2018-01-31 13:17:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-31 14:51:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

After this patch is applied, mydashboard/templates/mydashboard/base.html is generated without any errors, but the generated base.html looks incomplete because '[%' and '%]' are not valid directive in django templates.

In addition, I cannot understand why templates/mydashboard/base.html is needed."}, {'account_id': 27277, 'date': '2018-01-31 20:24:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27277, 'date': '2018-01-31 20:29:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> After this patch is applied, mydashboard/templates/mydashboard/base.html
 > is generated without any errors, but the generated base.html looks
 > incomplete because '[%' and '%]' are not valid directive in django
 > templates.
 > 
 > In addition, I cannot understand why templates/mydashboard/base.html
 > is needed.

Thanks for review, I change "[ and ]" to "{ and }".

Regarding of base.html template. It seems that it will be used later with panel templates. 

Best Regards 
Ameed'}, {'account_id': 27657, 'date': '2018-02-04 06:28:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27277, 'date': '2018-02-04 07:01:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}, {'account_id': 30431, 'date': '2019-05-14 09:05:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

change all "{}" to "[]"'}]

Fix horizon start a new dashboard

When we try to start a new dashboard , the error appears
"'horizon' is not a registered tag library".

Closes-bug: #1743493

Use cirros version dynamically

The default version for cirros is 0.3.6 while cleanup-network.sh
contained hardcoded 0.3.5.  The patch changes to use version that was
configured.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-13 18:10:07.000000000', 'message': "Fix haproxy firewall rules

The problem we want to selve is that the change
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/631486/ (moving iptables creation to the
host) never really worked.

The reason it never worked and we never noticed is two-fold:
A) It ran: -e include ::tripleo::profile::base::haproxy
the problem is that without quoting puppet basically does a noop

B) Once the quoting is fixed it breaks because 'export FACTER_step'
exports a custom fact but does not export a hiera key per-se (so calls
to hiera('step') would fail

So we add proper quoting only on the variables that are arguments to a
parameter so that there is no risk of ansible doing the wrong thing and
puppet gets the correct arguments.

We also explicitely set the step for hiera in the deploy_steps_tasks.
The reason we need it is because in non-HA the iptables rules would
be created at step 1. But since the deploy_steps_tasks run before the
actual tasks that set the step hieradata.we would get the following
error:
Error: Function lookup() did not find a value for the name 'step'

We can just write out the step hiera key during the deploy_steps_tasks,
it will be enforced again shortly afterwards once the
common/deploy-steps-tasks.yaml gets invoked.

We also switch back to puppet_execute: ::tripleo::profile::base::haproxy
even for the pacemaker profile. This was broken by the flattening of the
haproxy service (Id55ae44a7b1b5f08b40170f7406e14973fa93639)

Co-Authored-By: Luca Miccini <lmiccini@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Iab310207ca17a6c596470dda30a39e029c4fe09c
Closes-Bug: #1828250
(cherry picked from commit ef6c23ef64ec7d96a45aabb844cf9451c27ae29c)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix haproxy firewall rules

The problem we want to selve is that the change
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/631486/ (moving iptables creation to the
host) never really worked.

The reason it never worked and we never noticed is two-fold:
A) It ran: -e include ::tripleo::profile::base::haproxy
the problem is that without quoting puppet basically does a noop

B) Once the quoting is fixed it breaks because 'export FACTER_step'
exports a custom fact but does not export a hiera key per-se (so calls
to hiera('step') would fail

So we add proper quoting only on the variables that are arguments to a
parameter so that there is no risk of ansible doing the wrong thing and
puppet gets the correct arguments.

We also explicitely set the step for hiera in the deploy_steps_tasks.
The reason we need it is because in non-HA the iptables rules would
be created at step 1. But since the deploy_steps_tasks run before the
actual tasks that set the step hieradata.we would get the following
error:
Error: Function lookup() did not find a value for the name 'step'

We can just write out the step hiera key during the deploy_steps_tasks,
it will be enforced again shortly afterwards once the
common/deploy-steps-tasks.yaml gets invoked.

We also switch back to puppet_execute: ::tripleo::profile::base::haproxy
even for the pacemaker profile. This was broken by the flattening of the
haproxy service (Id55ae44a7b1b5f08b40170f7406e14973fa93639)

Co-Authored-By: Luca Miccini <lmiccini@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Iab310207ca17a6c596470dda30a39e029c4fe09c
Closes-Bug: #1828250
(cherry picked from commit ef6c23ef64ec7d96a45aabb844cf9451c27ae29c)

commit_message:
Ansible flush_handlers ignores conditional clauses

The flush_handlers clause doesn't honour conditional clauses.
Instead, it prints a warning and runs anyway:
[WARNING]: flush_handlers task does not support when conditional

See: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/41126

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Iaf70c2e932ae6dfb723bdb2ba658acdbfe74ebe2

commit_message:
Let fluentd not create /etc/rsyslog.d/fluentd.conf file

Currently, when fluentd is configured to listen to syslogs, Fluentd
configures itself and also rsyslog creating the file
/etc/rsyslog.d/fluentd.conf. This generates an issue when
is deployed on RHEL BZ #1701726.

To avoid this issue, a fluentd_managed_rsyslog parameter is added so
fluentd can be configured to create the file or not.

Change-Id: I388180dc991926ff30f8bbc556f61447152f8dc9

commit_message:
Add use_required_attribute = False in Add Interface Form

When an element is required and hidden,
the browser will report an error when submitting the form.

Here is the code location where Django adds the required attribute to the element:
https://github.com/django/django/blob/master/django/forms/boundfield.py#L221-L222

Change-Id: I68e1145efbe1837861aa1d66fceec497d6d97cb9
Closes-Bug: #1811181

commit_message:
Avoid negative expression in query filter

Negative expression for SQL query is not straight forward expression.
This patch replaces negative expression with positive expression in
db.sql.utils.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-13 14:26:35.000000000', 'message': 'report the URL when heartbeats fail

We have seen issues in misconfigured systems where messages from IPA
to ironic fail with 404 or other standard HTTP error codes. The
messages do not include the URL of the service IPA is trying to talk
to, which makes debugging the configuration difficult. This change
adds the URLs to the end of a couple of errors already being reported
to improve that situation.

Change-Id: I6a4ea8768df016e58a073d78edbe4006e217d69e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
report the URL when heartbeats fail

We have seen issues in misconfigured systems where messages from IPA
to ironic fail with 404 or other standard HTTP error codes. The
messages do not include the URL of the service IPA is trying to talk
to, which makes debugging the configuration difficult. This change
adds the URLs to the end of a couple of errors already being reported
to improve that situation.

Change-Id: I6a4ea8768df016e58a073d78edbe4006e217d69e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Import python-barbicanclient-devstack

Move definition of job python-barbicanclient-devstack in-repo from
openstack-zuul-jobs.

Note that python-barbicanclient-devstack is only run on ocata,
newer branches use python-barbicanclient-dsvm.

commit_message:
Run voting jobs in gate as well

In OpenStack CI we run voting jobs in general in both check and gate
queue to ensure that the change as merged is fully tested.

Mark passing job as voting and add to gate, mark other job as
non-voting.

Change-Id: Ib1338a2f4260fee871b6dd4b0e7f3d4a6af77d02

commit_message:
Blacklist bandit 1.6.0

There's a regression[0] in bandit 1.6.0 which causes bandit to stop
respecting excluded directories, and our tests throw a bunch of
violations. Blacklist this version, but allow newer versions as there is
already a pull request[1] to fix it, and I expect it will be included in
the next release.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

Change-Id: Ie4dbfb3f54e4aac00e0537d5760b7a8fc81b35a2
(cherry picked from commit ebac8330d8ac81c491a1cb0e16eb23b93d7932ee)

subject: Spec: Support filtering by multiple trees
messages:
[{'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-04-09 07:15:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-04-09 14:44:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(5 comments)

Generally, this seems fine. It's an extension to query parameter handling that is in line with other changes we've made in the past. I've got some questions within about parameter length, and the choice of names, but overall I think we can evolve this to something worth doing."}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-04-12 02:53:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Looks like at least CERN doesn't have this use case. I'd like to hold this before seeing the real users."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-12 21:52:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> Looks like at least CERN doesn't have this use case. I'd like to hold this before seeing the real users.

Yeah this is coming from the nova situation where you could technically force a baremetal server create to a specific compute host which is managing hundreds of ironic baremetal nodes and the scheduler won't be able to use in_tree to optimize the results from placement, but that's a pretty nutty use case anyway IMO and nova already works around it by removing the limit on the GET /a_c call so until someone comes along with a more realistic/sane use case for this I say let's not worry about adding more complication to placement for it."}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-05-14 05:59:34.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

This spec proposes to support multiple resource provider uuids in
the ``in_tree`` queryparam to ``GET /resource_providers`` and
``GET /allocation_candidates``.

Change-Id: I7f44e66c51750053283b9f74ca63397f2793ef50
Story: 2005408
Task: 30423
'}]
commit_message:
Spec: Support filtering by multiple trees

This spec proposes to support multiple resource provider uuids in
the ``in_tree`` queryparam to ``GET /resource_providers`` and
``GET /allocation_candidates``.

Change-Id: I7f44e66c51750053283b9f74ca63397f2793ef50
Story: 2005408
Task: 30423

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-13 17:56:21.000000000', 'message': 'Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start capping
it there as well.

Change-Id: I4ee88377e7123c165434765a73f27cabec8c8177
Reference: https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489
'}]
commit_message:
Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start capping
it there as well.

Change-Id: I4ee88377e7123c165434765a73f27cabec8c8177
Reference: https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489
