subject: py3: finish porting proxy/test_server.py
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-05-07 22:45:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-05-07 23:13:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2019-05-08 21:51:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Make sure to look at parse_headers_string(). It parses a binary strng, so tries to store headers with bytes for names (keys in HeadersDict). As a result, nothing compares with literals like 'Content-Length'. I'd prefer leaving literal key names wihtout b'' and converting in parse_headers_string()."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-05-08 22:36:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Make sure to look at parse_headers_string(). ... I'd prefer leaving literal key names wihtout b'' and converting in parse_headers_string().

Check; done in the parent patch: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/657699/2/test/unit/proxy/test_server.py@146

I agree, definitely better to keep the strings as native strings if at all possible.

There's still a bit of work needed around https://review.opendev.org/#/c/657700/2/test/unit/proxy/test_server.py@10199 to ensure the proxy under test is using the SwiftHttpProtocol so it correctly handles unquoted paths. Then I'm down to just one unexplained failure..."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-05-08 22:59:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-05-09 00:47:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-05-09 15:05:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck

using the full path to the driver and not just specifying the module.
Use of the module path for this setting was deprecated several releases
ago and removed in Stein.

Change-Id: I6b9722ab0d7a8bdf808bd937b0c237e3715ccaab

'}]
commit_message:
Add upgrade checker for backup driver path

This adds an upgrade check to make sure the backup_driver setting is
using the full path to the driver and not just specifying the module.
Use of the module path for this setting was deprecated several releases
ago and removed in Stein.

Change-Id: I6b9722ab0d7a8bdf808bd937b0c237e3715ccaab
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit cef38b5e849bad294374adaf213efabfc26b0d5c)

commit_message:
allow building docs without ceilometer client

CeilometerClient has been deprecated and is no longer available for
master. Without ceilometer client installed docs fail to build with
an exception [1].

This patch marks the import optional.

subject: Remove watcher.openstack.common=WARN from _DEFAULT_LOG_LEVELS
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-10 15:34:28.000000000', 'message': 'Remove watcher.openstack.common=WARN from _DEFAULT_LOG_LEVELS

Hard-coding watcher.openstack.common to warning level logging
only makes it hard to debug watcher's interactions with other
services, like when it's triggering and monitoring a server live
migration.

Since debug logging is controlled via the "debug" configuration
option, we can just rely on that to filter out debug logs within
watcher itself.

Note this has been this way since change
I699e0ab082657880998d8618fe29eb7f56c6c661 back in 2015 and there
was no explanation why the watcher.openstack.common logging
was set to WARN level.

Change-Id: I939403a4ae36d1aa9ea83badb9404bc37d18a1a6
Related-Bug: #1828598
'}]
commit_message:
Remove watcher.openstack.common=WARN from _DEFAULT_LOG_LEVELS

Hard-coding watcher.openstack.common to warning level logging
only makes it hard to debug watcher's interactions with other
services, like when it's triggering and monitoring a server live
migration.

Since debug logging is controlled via the "debug" configuration
option, we can just rely on that to filter out debug logs within
watcher itself.

Note this has been this way since change
I699e0ab082657880998d8618fe29eb7f56c6c661 back in 2015 and there
was no explanation why the watcher.openstack.common logging
was set to WARN level.

Change-Id: I939403a4ae36d1aa9ea83badb9404bc37d18a1a6
Related-Bug: #1828598

follow up change.

Closes-Bug: #1828698

commit_message:
Use upper-constraints in tox runs

The upper-constraints file wasn't being enforced
when installing dependencies in tox runs which can
lead to failures like installing Sphinx>2.0 in py27
where it's not supported.

This is loosely based on novaclient change
I8be883215f27abb58d15b85e8542cbdf32000bac for the
same kind of issue.

Note there are other things that should be done
in here regarding requirements cleanup, like the
sphinx dependnecies should move to a
doc/requirements.txt file to separate them from
unit test runs, but that can be dealt with in a
follow up change.

Change-Id: I359a35af5b653299110a8d0faddb255da0b10118
Closes-Bug: #1828698

commit_message:
Bandit test exclusions syntax change

Newer versions of bandit broke their handling of test exclusion
directories. It is now necessary to glob the contents of the directory
rather than just list the base path.

Change-Id: I02fbc02ce8d623b75a7d568ea48bb5e5e6c66b58
(cherry picked from commit 1a87298ac774d921709ab9cbe5016414db65783e)

commit_message:
Bandit test exclusions syntax change

Newer versions of bandit broke their handling of test exclusion
directories. It is now necessary to glob the contents of the directory
rather than just list the base path.

Change-Id: I02fbc02ce8d623b75a7d568ea48bb5e5e6c66b58
(cherry picked from commit 1a87298ac774d921709ab9cbe5016414db65783e)

commit_message:
Blacklist bandit 1.6.0

There's a regression[0] in bandit 1.6.0 which causes bandit to stop
respecting excluded directories, and our tests throw a bunch of
violations. Blacklist this version, but allow newer versions as there is
already a pull request[1] to fix it, and I expect it will be included in
the next release.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

Change-Id: Ie4dbfb3f54e4aac00e0537d5760b7a8fc81b35a2
(cherry picked from commit ebac8330d8ac81c491a1cb0e16eb23b93d7932ee)

parameter 'project_tags' to RequestContext so that oslo.context
allows services that use it to benefit.

[{'created': '2019-04-22 05:30:02.000000000', 'message': "[PoC] Expose 'project_tags' in auth token

Introduce new attribute which is exposed in a authentication token
'project_tags'. 'Tag' is a concept which is globally used in OpenStack
[1], but currently there is a barrier to use this conecpt in that
admins have to request the project 'tag' to Keystone when they want to
apply 'tag' concept for each OpenStack services.

Encode project_tags when a project has tags into auth token so that
OpenStack services can use it directly in the token.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/tags.html

Change-Id: Idf82f34cea2998894ac3da52dd65203e21a5d531
Closes-bug: #1807697

commit_message:
[PoC] Expose 'project_tags' in auth token

Introduce new attribute which is exposed in a authentication token
'project_tags'. 'Tag' is a concept which is globally used in OpenStack
[1], but currently there is a barrier to use this conecpt in that
admins have to request the project 'tag' to Keystone when they want to
apply 'tag' concept for each OpenStack services.

Encode project_tags when a project has tags into auth token so that
OpenStack services can use it directly in the token.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/tags.html

Change-Id: Idf82f34cea2998894ac3da52dd65203e21a5d531
Closes-bug: #1807697

commit_message:
Blacklist bandit 1.6.0

There's a regression[0] in bandit 1.6.0 which causes bandit to stop
respecting excluded directories, and our tests throw a bunch of
violations. Blacklist this version, but allow newer versions as there is
already a pull request[1] to fix it, and I expect it will be included in
the next release.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

commit_message:
Limit cluster update properties

Magnum only allows the node count of cluster being updated. And
in mangum ui, cluster and cluster template are sharing same
function to generating the patch json dict, which is causing lots
of bugs before. So let's define a set for cluster update allowed
properties and use it to restrict the patch json dict.

Task: 26699
Story: 2003865

Change-Id: I2f0126fbf2f7396dda504b988ee11659824fcde8
(cherry picked from commit 895e5095c35ffe5c9c9688339c5da05f437893d5)

commit_message:
Import placement auth vars to global scope

Following precedent in the os_nova role[0], nova will use the
placement API credentials to access the placement service. Since
these defaults are used between both the placement and nova roles
they must be scoped in the 'all' group vars.

Change-Id: I25ce79b9e3492cb075c50beed90ea2b78055e474

commit_message:
Set nodepool mirror PIP_OPTS consistently

The bootstrap-ansible script does not always run as a child of the
gate-check-commit, so bootstrap-ansible should be prepared to load
the nodepool PIP mirrors itself. Move the nodepool mirror detection
into a common function so it can be used in both bootstrap-ansible
and gate-check-commit.

Change-Id: Ie5c8d65aee11d6dba18a0388467783cc6e9e5d36

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-13 00:55:29.000000000', 'message': 'Update ARA installation and loading

- Allow ARA installation to be disabled in gate-check-commit. For
  backwards compatibility, this remains defaulted to true. However
  in the OSA gate, the pre-run playbook will install ARA so we set
  it to false during the gate-check-commit run rather than waste
  time installing it twice.

- Separate the ARA installation from loading. Continue installing
  ARA using the setup_ara function, but do not load ARA into the
  callback plugins env var there. Instead, we will load ARA into
  the ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS inside the openstack-ansible wrapper
  if it is installed.

- Move ARA installation function call to run right after the
  ansible-runtime venv is created. This makes little difference
  except that ARA will now be installed in time for the
  get-ansible-role-requirements role clone run.

commit_message:
Update ARA installation and loading

- Allow ARA installation to be disabled in gate-check-commit. For
  backwards compatibility, this remains defaulted to true. However
  in the OSA gate, the pre-run playbook will install ARA so we set
  it to false during the gate-check-commit run rather than waste
  time installing it twice.

- Separate the ARA installation from loading. Continue installing
  ARA using the setup_ara function, but do not load ARA into the
  callback plugins env var there. Instead, we will load ARA into
  the ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS inside the openstack-ansible wrapper
  if it is installed.

- Move ARA installation function call to run right after the
  ansible-runtime venv is created. This makes little difference
  except that ARA will now be installed in time for the
  get-ansible-role-requirements role clone run.

Change-Id: I8ec359f5c65c957064a39b75b9c3ea3d3a9d9e89

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-11 05:01:27.000000000', 'message': "Run the OSA bootstrap in the Zuul pre phase

We will now run the bootstrap-ansible and bootstrap-aio scripts in
the Zuul pre-run job phase. This has several benefits:

- Job stability will be higher. When we occasionally receive nodepool
  instances with unreliable networking, the job will often die off
  during the role clone due to git or pip internet resource
  unavailability. Jobs that fail during pre-run will be retried
  several times by Zuul using different nodes/clouds.

- Jobs which inherit the integrated role's job definition may add
  pre-run playbooks of their own, which allow child jobs to
  configure OSA parameters in /etc/openstack_deploy (such as custom
  user variables or conf.d definitions). Child job pre-run playbooks
  will run after the parent's, so the child job can configure itself
  with the beneift of an already bootstrapped OSA AIO configuration.

Environment variables are used to skip the bootstrap scripts when
executing gate-check-commit during the job's run phase.

Change-Id: I0e77423a1f28d9a53215ae68c1f9f3e2af00f340

We will now run the bootstrap-ansible and bootstrap-aio scripts in
the Zuul pre-run job phase. This has several benefits:

- Job stability will be higher. When we occasionally receive nodepool
  instances with unreliable networking, the job will often die off
  during the role clone due to git or pip internet resource
  unavailability. Jobs that fail during pre-run will be retried
  several times by Zuul using different nodes/clouds.

- Jobs which inherit the integrated role's job definition may add
  pre-run playbooks of their own, which allow child jobs to
  configure OSA parameters in /etc/openstack_deploy (such as custom
  user variables or conf.d definitions). Child job pre-run playbooks
  will run after the parent's, so the child job can configure itself
  with the benefit of an already bootstrapped OSA AIO configuration.

- The Zuul pre-run phase runs on a separate timeout from the run
  phase, so our run playbook will have more time available to it
  due to the bootstrapping being done before the run timeout begins.

Environment variables are used to skip the bootstrap scripts when
executing gate-check-commit during the job's run phase.

Change-Id: I0e77423a1f28d9a53215ae68c1f9f3e2af00f340

We will now run the bootstrap-ansible and bootstrap-aio scripts in
the Zuul pre-run job phase. This has several benefits:

- Job stability will be higher. When we occasionally receive nodepool
  instances with unreliable networking, the job will often die off
  during the role clone due to git or pip internet resource
  unavailability. Jobs that fail during pre-run will be retried
  several times by Zuul using different nodes/clouds.

- Jobs which inherit the integrated role's job definition may add
  pre-run playbooks of their own, which allow child jobs to
  configure OSA parameters in /etc/openstack_deploy (such as custom
  user variables or conf.d definitions). Child job pre-run playbooks
  will run after the parent's, so the child job can configure itself
  with the benefit of an already bootstrapped OSA AIO configuration.

- The Zuul pre-run phase runs on a separate timeout from the run
  phase, so our run playbook will have more time available to it
  due to the bootstrapping being done before the run timeout begins.

Environment variables are used to skip the bootstrap scripts when
executing gate-check-commit during the job's run phase.

Change-Id: I0e77423a1f28d9a53215ae68c1f9f3e2af00f340

commit_message:
Run the OSA bootstrap in the Zuul pre phase

We will now run the bootstrap-ansible and bootstrap-aio scripts in
the Zuul pre-run job phase. This has several benefits:

- Job stability will be higher. When we occasionally receive nodepool
  instances with unreliable networking, the job will often die off
  during the role clone due to git or pip internet resource
  unavailability. Jobs that fail during pre-run will be retried
  several times by Zuul using different nodes/clouds.

- Jobs which inherit the integrated role's job definition may add
  pre-run playbooks of their own, which allow child jobs to
  configure OSA parameters in /etc/openstack_deploy (such as custom
  user variables or conf.d definitions). Child job pre-run playbooks
  will run after the parent's, so the child job can configure itself
  with the benefit of an already bootstrapped OSA AIO configuration.

- The Zuul pre-run phase runs on a separate timeout from the run
  phase, so our run playbook will have more time available to it
  due to the bootstrapping being done before the run timeout begins.

Environment variables are used to skip the bootstrap scripts when
executing gate-check-commit during the job's run phase.

Change-Id: I0e77423a1f28d9a53215ae68c1f9f3e2af00f340

commit_message:
Move data device detection to Ansible

Move the detection of the secondary data disk device to the
bootstrap-host role. This is important because the detection was
previously done in bash in the gate-check-commit, but since
bootstrap-aio is executed independently of gate-check-commit in the
gate, the data disk is no longer being used correctly. Now the
data disk will bootstrap reliably regardless of how bootstrap-aio
is run.

Change-Id: I2d49b6802d8cf99f6d7ac74ae4ce0ab8f6d1c7a5

respecting excluded directories, and our tests throw a bunch of
violations. Blacklist this version, but allow newer versions as there is

the next release.

commit_message:
Blacklist bandit 1.6.0

There's a regression[0] in bandit 1.6.0 which causes bandit to stop
respecting excluded directories, and our tests throw a bunch of
violations. Blacklist this version, but allow newer versions as there is
already a pull request[1] to fix it, and I expect it will be included in
the next release.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

Change-Id: Ie4dbfb3f54e4aac00e0537d5760b7a8fc81b35a2
(cherry picked from commit ebac8330d8ac81c491a1cb0e16eb23b93d7932ee)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-09 06:27:20.000000000', 'message': 'Update Python 3 test runtimes for Train

Following the process set down in the TC resolution on updating Python
versions:

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20181024-python-update-process.html

Change-Id: Ied3c0fab32caf39cc34d9ce5d65551241c782f7b
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/641878/
'}, {'created': '2019-05-09 09:36:29.000000000', 'message': 'Update Python 3 test runtimes for Train

This goal is to implement the process set out in the 2018-10-24 Python
Update Process TC resolution[1], for the Train cycle to ensure unit
testing is in place for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train[2].
In practice, this generally means adding unit tests for Python 3.7 and dropping
unit tests for Python 3.5. Using the Zuul template for Train will ensure that
all projects that support Python3 will be tested against the agreed runtime
versions, and make it easier to update them in future.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20181024-python-update-process.html
[2]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: Ied3c0fab32caf39cc34d9ce5d65551241c782f7b
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/641878/
'}]
commit_message:
Update Python 3 test runtimes for Train

This goal is to implement the process set out in the 2018-10-24 Python
Update Process TC resolution[1], for the Train cycle to ensure unit
testing is in place for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train[2].
In practice, this generally means adding unit tests for Python 3.7 and dropping
unit tests for Python 3.5. Using the Zuul template for Train will ensure that
all projects that support Python3 will be tested against the agreed runtime
versions, and make it easier to update them in future.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20181024-python-update-process.html
[2]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: Ied3c0fab32caf39cc34d9ce5d65551241c782f7b
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/641878/

commit_message:
Make scenario construction more generic

The bootstrap host scenario was very quirky because we had to a maintain
a list of "special" scenario keywords that are not actual services,
otherwise the role would fail when deploying non-existent AIO conf.d
files.

Instead, we can simply pass a full expanded scenario list (including
the "special" keywords and all service keywords and only deploy the
conf.d files that exist in the repo.

This will make scenarios much more straight forward to use and less
flaky when adding scenario variants that may not have a conf.d file
to deploy.

Change-Id: I621660f39c4e51db4b8063feee782aae5cd16840

commit_message:
Fix identation in README so we can do a release

The following command was failing:

python3 setup.py check --restructuredtext --strict

This was preventing us from releasing for pike.

This also adds a couple of jobs to our zuul layout... since none were
matching.

Change-Id: Ic830d22de4bed08d782a3f5c49163bb122016361
(cherry picked from commit ed57f2eb8232e383ea4b8e7389e5c635f9816c94)

pin bandit < 1.6.0

The latest release introduced some backwards-incompatible behavior in
the way it handles skipping files.

Change-Id: Ic13df5bafab5c5e69b357042aa8438afdcf7b2bb
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: update sphinx dependency
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-13 14:52:45.000000000', 'message': 'update sphinx dependency

The sphinx dependency settings do not match those in the global
requirements list, which makes editing this file for other purposes
impossible. This patch fixes those settings to allow other changes.

Change-Id: Ia3028be645b33a812941f7dded35692dccb685ea
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
update sphinx dependency

The sphinx dependency settings do not match those in the global
requirements list, which makes editing this file for other purposes
impossible. This patch fixes those settings to allow other changes.

Change-Id: Ia3028be645b33a812941f7dded35692dccb685ea
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

kinda ok, but my main concern is that it looks like it's half developed (bunch of PRs, py34 specificed only)"}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2019-05-12 20:37:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

half developed?  That library has been around for years and used by the 3par driver in cinder for a very long time.  It's not 'half developed'.  It's a fully featured client library for the 3PAR storage devices that I originally authored back in 2012.  

Also, fwiw, I added the py37 to tox.ini and ran the tests and they passed just fine.

http://paste.openstack.org/show/5TPPZ7E0yIj1K4iyLCEZ/

I have a PR in to add py36 and py37 to tox.ini here:
https://github.com/hpe-storage/python-3parclient/pull/65"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-05-12 21:07:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

That's good (about the PR/tox).  What I meant by 'kinda developed' is more towards the activity on it (houscleaning things like PRs and the py3 stuff) than it is it's maturity.  If your PR is merged my worries would be addressed."}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2019-05-13 16:09:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

My 3parclient PR has  merged.  

https://github.com/hpe-storage/python-3parclient/pull/65'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2019-05-13 16:11:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-05-13 16:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-05-13 18:17:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Add cinder extras python-3parclient library

This patch adds the cinder 3par driver's library.

active: yes
good code: mostly, bunch of open, simple pull requests
py3: kinda? only states py34...
license compat: yes
packaged: eh?
covered by other libs: no
needed by: cinder
managed by openstack: no

Change-Id: I1fb6047b88ffa11783e0a7cc468df38b29c7a0bf

commit_message:
Prefer auth_uri in functests configs

The DevStack config sets auth_uri in the functest conf, some of the
other settings (like auth_ssl) are not as reliably correct.  This seems
to better conform to the DevStack configuration and seems reasonable to
support going forward if we want to move away from test configuration
from uri components.

Change-Id: Ic9fb077aab259ce03026acb5d86d6dc6068d5ca4

commit_message:
Grafana: Add security context to chart and read-only-fs

This PS adds the security context macros to the grafana chart,
and moves the default to read-only-rootfs for all containers

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-13 16:43:53.000000000', 'message': 'Remove neutron-lbaas reference in .zuul

Neutron-lbaas is being retired [1] and references to that project need
to be removed from zuul jobs.

Senlin is already using octavia so those references to neutron-lbaas are
left-over from when the switch to octavia was made.

[1]
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/006142.html

Change-Id: Ideec4717d5a0577ebb49c93f1132ecedbc90d869
'}]
commit_message:
Remove neutron-lbaas reference in .zuul

Neutron-lbaas is being retired [1] and references to that project need
to be removed from zuul jobs.

Senlin is already using octavia so those references to neutron-lbaas are
left-over from when the switch to octavia was made.

[1]
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/006142.html

Change-Id: Ideec4717d5a0577ebb49c93f1132ecedbc90d869

commit_message:
Aodh deprecation, update enable_telemetry flag.

Currently aodh is deprecated in stein release,
and planned to be removed in the next release. So
we need to update the enable_telemetry flag to not
include the undercloud-aodh.yaml.

Change-Id: I79b984f5ab28a5381900ada294c0ee62d9a1bde3

commit_message:
Aodh deprecation, update enable_telemetry flag.

Currently aodh is deprecated in stein release,
and planned to be removed in the next release. So
we need to update the enable_telemetry flag to not
include the undercloud-aodh.yaml.

Change-Id: I79b984f5ab28a5381900ada294c0ee62d9a1bde3

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: Ia9676814bdaa20b200f50f71edb461dffd72006e
Sem-Ver: feature

subject: Remove charm-vault from zuul.d/projects.yaml
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 935, 'name': 'James Page', 'email': 'james.page@canonical.com', 'username': 'james-page'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 20805, 'name': 'David Ames', 'email': 'david@davam.net', 'username': 'thedac'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26040, 'name': 'Pete Vander Giessen', 'email': 'pete.vandergiessen@canonical.com', 'username': 'petevg'}, {'_account_id': 30418, 'name': 'George Kraft', 'email': 'george.kraft@canonical.com', 'username': 'cynerva'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 26040, 'date': '2019-05-09 18:41:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26040, 'date': '2019-05-09 18:43:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-05-09 18:52:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Looking at https://opendev.org/x/charm-vault/src/branch/master/.zuul.yaml you will not be able to merge any changes to x/charm-vault once this merges *unless* you add a "noop" job to the gate queue.

The cover-jobs template has no gate jobs and you always need a gate job to merge anything...

Also, since you're not a core of charm-vault, I'd like to see some cores +1 this change.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-05-09 18:53:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

sorry, see you are a core - still, please ask some other cores to chime in...'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2019-05-09 19:01:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Looks good.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2019-05-09 19:02:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

Whoops, missed Andreas comment.'}, {'account_id': 26040, 'date': '2019-05-09 19:07:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Andreas Jaeger: The blocked merge proposal adds python35-charm-jobs to the .zuul.yaml. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/658153/3

Is that sufficient to address the concern that you bring up? Or does the change to the .zuul.yaml need to get merged before we make this change (and thus before the other changes in that mp are merged)?'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-05-09 19:11:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yes, merging a change that adds python35 jobs will be enough...

so, we can merge this - and then you need to merge a change that adds job for the gate queue like python35 jobs...

If that's how the charm-vault team want to move forward, ok with me - but please ask for some +1s.."}, {'account_id': 26040, 'date': '2019-05-09 19:13:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Andreas Jaeger: thx for the confirmation! +1s on this end I think are just waiting on a lunch break :-)'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2019-05-09 20:01:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

OK, looks like we have it sorted. Confirmed we will be adding the .zuul.yaml change immediately after this lands.'}, {'account_id': 30418, 'date': '2019-05-09 21:25:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-05-10 06:16:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-05-10 14:06:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-05-13 20:46:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Remove charm-vault from zuul.d/projects.yaml

charm-vault has a .zuul.yaml to govern the tests that it runs. There
is no need to clobber with the defaults here.

This addresses an issue where a merge proposal is blocked by
erroneously failing python 2.7 tests.

Change-Id: I418073c7cb6016bf2a10947815816642b0d38662

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I00d4b8a6f5687811af58960d5538c50ebe9fac4c

commit_message:
Neutron-lbaas: temporarily remove pypi job

Neutron-lbaas is being retired but stable branches should still build
and publish correctly. So, remove this template just long enough to
merge the retirement patches in the repos, and then put it back in the
followup.

Change-Id: I6dc829fdfcad5578120da0ba335fa17df97ecc78

[{'created': '2019-03-30 08:42:45.000000000', 'message': "Prevent use of KVM for Tenks VMs in CI

Currently nested virtualisation under KVM does not seem to be working in
CI. This breaks the 'bare metal' deployment testing using Tenks, which
lead us to disable it in 749ef8243e9ae855cf8ceb54dc3f88c6c1b2fea0.

This commit forces Tenks to use QEMU for its VMs, allowing us to revert
commit 749ef8243e9ae855cf8ceb54dc3f88c6c1b2fea0..

Change-Id: Id382c218f3b37979341f0d96718a6011a1d9da37

(cherry picked from commit 08bb1441ebc46beeeb2359b434dc99559adb6540)
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent use of KVM for Tenks VMs in CI

Currently nested virtualisation under KVM does not seem to be working in
CI. This breaks the 'bare metal' deployment testing using Tenks, which
lead us to disable it in 749ef8243e9ae855cf8ceb54dc3f88c6c1b2fea0.

This commit forces Tenks to use QEMU for its VMs, allowing us to revert
commit 749ef8243e9ae855cf8ceb54dc3f88c6c1b2fea0..

Change-Id: Id382c218f3b37979341f0d96718a6011a1d9da37
Story: 2005316
Task: 30223
(cherry picked from commit 08bb1441ebc46beeeb2359b434dc99559adb6540)

[{'created': '2019-05-13 08:21:53.000000000', 'message': "Add upper-constraints enforcement for local reqs

This adds the use of upper constraints in our tox environments. Jobs
like openstack-tox-py27 have started failing due to trying to install
lib versions that only support Python 3.

The 'generate' target keeps the unconstrained deps since we actually do
need the latest installed for that.

"}]
commit_message:
Add upper-constraints enforcement for local reqs

This adds the use of upper constraints in our tox environments. Jobs
like openstack-tox-py27 have started failing due to trying to install
lib versions that only support Python 3.

The 'generate' target keeps the unconstrained deps since we actually do
need the latest installed for that.

NOTE(dmllr): updated install_command to include local constraints file

Change-Id: I2598503c2d4397d7efbb03a76df9a4e91dd0c1cf
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8bad9fe19d09eb2e49fd44b92c57ee5acf85b558)

subject: WES WIP - Add fedora-28 support to container-build job on fedora-28 with Buildah
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-12 04:02:21.000000000', 'message': "WES WIP - Add fedora-28 support to container-build job on fedora-28 with Buildah

We are switching from Docker to Buildah and building containers on
CentOS7 isn't really good for these reasons:

- fuse-overlayfs isn't available in CentOS7 ans is extremely useful to
  build the images faster, otherwise we have to use vfs which is really
  too slow.
  See https://www.scrivano.org/2018/07/13/fuse-overlayfs-moved-to-github-com-containers/
- the version of Buildah + dependencies is more recent in Fedora.

We still continue to build centos7 containers, but we need to build them
from a different platform.

Note: We'll also have to patch RDO periodic jobs to run this playbook on
      Fedora.
      We also make sure Buildah is only used in Stein and beyond as we
      don't support it before.
      Also, the centos-7 job is still needed in kolla CI. We won't
      remove it for now.

Change-Id: Ie342477e841d2b9fefe8797b64c717c4b166e145
Depends-On: I7608136cb213bdca81348a0c3c751b488f48d712
Depends-On: Ieff41a5f84456530b4621218b01f3b546cd867bf
"}, {'created': '2019-02-12 04:19:22.000000000', 'message': "WES WIP - Add fedora-28 support to container-build job on fedora-28 with Buildah

We are switching from Docker to Buildah and building containers on
CentOS7 isn't really good for these reasons:

- fuse-overlayfs isn't available in CentOS7 ans is extremely useful to

We still continue to build centos7 containers, but we need to build them

      Also, the centos-7 job is still needed in kolla CI. We won't

Change-Id: Ie342477e841d2b9fefe8797b64c717c4b166e145

"}]
commit_message:
WES WIP - Add fedora-28 support to container-build job on fedora-28 with Buildah

We are switching from Docker to Buildah and building containers on
CentOS7 isn't really good for these reasons:

- fuse-overlayfs isn't available in CentOS7 ans is extremely useful to
  build the images faster, otherwise we have to use vfs which is really
  too slow.
  See https://www.scrivano.org/2018/07/13/fuse-overlayfs-moved-to-github-com-containers/
- the version of Buildah + dependencies is more recent in Fedora.

We still continue to build centos7 containers, but we need to build them
from a different platform.

Note: We'll also have to patch RDO periodic jobs to run this playbook on
      Fedora.
      We also make sure Buildah is only used in Stein and beyond as we
      don't support it before.
      Also, the centos-7 job is still needed in kolla CI. We won't
      remove it for now.

Change-Id: Ie342477e841d2b9fefe8797b64c717c4b166e145
Depends-On: I7608136cb213bdca81348a0c3c751b488f48d712
Depends-On: Ieff41a5f84456530b4621218b01f3b546cd867bf

commit_message:
DNM: Test push containers for buildah jobs

Push to local registry to isolate possible issues/specifics of
rdo registry in the promotion jobs.

Change-Id: I03ecb21638b9ec4ee310cea4c4b32ee6d48d824b

commit_message:
custom_dns in ipa deployment is the dns forwarder

Set the custom dns setting to a known good
public dns to forward requests to.

Change-Id: Iec36b8db1dbdf79786a7cccfe7d4476c4806259c

[WIP] Move legacy jobs to project

Move jobs to murano-pkg-check repo

commit_message:
Update tests to work with updated cluster delete

This patch adds test for deleting a cluster with resources
attached to it. This test ensures that a cluster delete
will complete even if a policy or receiver is attached to it.

Change-Id: I3d3d018b0862f9f265eb4fcf53805bdd7bc45599

commit_message:
Support the prometheus pushgateway

This patch implements the support for the pushgateway in
kolla-ansible

The configuration and prechecks are reused from the other exporters

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/657771/1
Change-Id: Iad9fa717f7d2a77753c66dd33ea4ccf1d5296993

commit_message:
Update linting jobs

The linters job did not run any tests at all since there was no
linters environment and the default environment only removes all pyc
files.

Add a linters environment that runs ansible-lint and syntax tests.

Remove the ansible-linters template, it's not needed anymore, the
linters jobs are enough.

The ansible-linters legacy jobs failed to detect some problems, mark
them with noqa for now.

The backport found few more problems, blacklist those new tests.

Change-Id: Ibfa5ae179a98c57df2151cc633eb849ec8359a95
(cherry picked from commit ffe104c743ea983fb268cf7ac8e868cc24b91475)

commit_message:
Update linting jobs

The linters job did not run any tests at all since there was no
linters environment and the default environment only removes all pyc
files.

Add a linters environment that runs ansible-lint and syntax tests.

Remove the ansible-linters template, it's not needed anymore, the
linters jobs are enough.

The ansible-linters legacy jobs failed to detect some problems, mark
them with noqa for now.

Change-Id: Ibfa5ae179a98c57df2151cc633eb849ec8359a95

Ok so the original change of moving iptables rules to deploy_step_tasks, never actually worked due to the missing quotes:
[root@controller-0 ~]# puppet apply --color=false --modulepath '/etc/puppet/modules:/opt/stack/puppet-modules:/usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules' --tags 'tripleo::firewall::rule,tripleo::haproxy::endpoint' -e include ::yomama

Now this review works okay *but* it breaks UC with:
Error: Function lookup() did not find a value for the name 'step'"

So TLDR;: we need to add quotes around all parameters that require an argument and force-export the step fact'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-05-10 10:27:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> So TLDR;: we need to add quotes around all parameters that require
 > an argument and force-export the step fact

Reason for this is that export FACTER_step seems to not work, not sure why yet.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-05-10 11:15:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-05-10 11:16:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-05-10 11:21:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I am not yet sold on abusing the uuid hiera file for this, but could not come up with a better solution'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-05-10 12:37:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-05-10 13:22:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

So I'm not sure why the env var wouldn't be picked up automatically (nor I recall why we needed to set that fact explicitly in the original https://review.opendev.org/#/c/631486), but I'm afraid of the side effects of not deleting that file on disk if <REASON> happens.

I was about to suggest to name that file /etc/puppet/hieradata/config_step.json, so that way it would ensure that the value of step would be updated during deployment as necessary and we wouldn't end up with two different values to reconcile.

I guess at this point I don't get why we don't seem to generate config_step.json at all on the undercloud, nor how all our puppet modules are supposed to work if they can't get the step value."}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-05-10 14:02:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-05-10 14:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-08 15:17:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fix haproxy firewall rules

The problem we want to selve is that the change https://review.opendev.org/#/c/631486/
(moving iptables creation to the host broke composable ha when services
are not running on the controller).  We need to add --tags
'tripleo::haproxy::endpoint' to the tags of the puppet invocation,
otherwise the implicit rules insidate tripleo::haproxy::endpoint will
never be created.

With this tag we get all the proper haproxy firewall rules as expected:
-A INPUT -p tcp -m multiport --dports 8042 -m state --state NEW -m comment --comment "100 aodh_haproxy ipv4" -j ACCEPT
-A INPUT -p tcp -m multiport --dports 13042 -m state --state NEW -m comment --comment "100 aodh_haproxy_ssl ipv4" -j ACCEPT
...

Previously we did not create the haproxy rules at all.

We also verified that adding this tag does not create haproxy.config
files on the host.

Co-Authored-By: Luca Miccini <lmiccini@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Iab310207ca17a6c596470dda30a39e029c4fe09c
Closes-Bug: #1828250

'}, {'created': '2019-05-10 11:15:52.000000000', 'message': "Fix haproxy firewall rules

The problem we want to selve is that the change https://review.opendev.org/#/c/631486/
(moving iptables creation to the host) never really worked.

The reason it never worked and we never noticed is two-fold:
A) It ran: -e include ::tripleo::profile::base::haproxy
the problem is that without quoting puppet basically does a noop

B) Once the quoting is fixed it breaks because 'export FACTER_step'
exports a custom fact but does not export a hiera key per-se (so calls
to hiera('step') would fail

So we add proper quoting only on the variables that are
arguments to a parameter so that there is no risk of ansible doing the
wrong thing and puppet gets the correct arguments.

We also need to properly set the step variable (albeit temporarily) via
the uuid hiera key.

NB: we need to still explore if there is no better way to do this except
abusing the uuid hiera file..

Co-Authored-By: Luca Miccini <lmiccini@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Iab310207ca17a6c596470dda30a39e029c4fe09c
Closes-Bug: #1828250
"}, {'created': '2019-05-10 12:37:49.000000000', 'message': "Fix haproxy firewall rules

to hiera('step') would fail

So we add proper quoting only on the variables that are arguments to a
parameter so that there is no risk of ansible doing the wrong thing and
puppet gets the correct arguments.

Since we also need to properly set the step variable but only temporarily
we also introduce the 'temp_override' hieradata hierarchy file. It is
expected that this file gets populated and then removed right after its
usage.

Co-Authored-By: Luca Miccini <lmiccini@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Iab310207ca17a6c596470dda30a39e029c4fe09c
Closes-Bug: #1828250

Co-Authored-By: Luca Miccini <lmiccini@redhat.com>

"}, {'created': '2019-05-10 14:53:09.000000000', 'message': "Fix haproxy firewall rules

The problem we want to selve is that the change
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/631486/ (moving iptables creation to the
host) never really worked.

The reason it never worked and we never noticed is two-fold:
A) It ran: -e include ::tripleo::profile::base::haproxy
the problem is that without quoting puppet basically does a noop

B) Once the quoting is fixed it breaks because 'export FACTER_step'
exports a custom fact but does not export a hiera key per-se (so calls
to hiera('step') would fail

So we add proper quoting only on the variables that are arguments to a
parameter so that there is no risk of ansible doing the wrong thing and
puppet gets the correct arguments.

We also explicitely set the step for hiera in the deploy_steps_tasks.
The reason we need it is because in non-HA the iptables rules would
be created at step 1. But since the deploy_steps_tasks run before the
actual tasks that set the step hieradata.we would get the following
error:
Error: Function lookup() did not find a value for the name 'step'

We can just write out the step hiera key during the deploy_steps_tasks,
it will be enforced again shortly afterwards once the
common/deploy-steps-tasks.yaml gets invoked.

We also switch back to puppet_execute: ::tripleo::profile::base::haproxy
even for the pacemaker profile. This was broken by the flattening of the
haproxy service (Id55ae44a7b1b5f08b40170f7406e14973fa93639)

Co-Authored-By: Luca Miccini <lmiccini@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Iab310207ca17a6c596470dda30a39e029c4fe09c
Closes-Bug: #1828250

commit_message:
Fix haproxy firewall rules

The problem we want to selve is that the change
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/631486/ (moving iptables creation to the
host) never really worked.

The reason it never worked and we never noticed is two-fold:
A) It ran: -e include ::tripleo::profile::base::haproxy
the problem is that without quoting puppet basically does a noop

B) Once the quoting is fixed it breaks because 'export FACTER_step'
exports a custom fact but does not export a hiera key per-se (so calls
to hiera('step') would fail

So we add proper quoting only on the variables that are arguments to a
parameter so that there is no risk of ansible doing the wrong thing and
puppet gets the correct arguments.

We also explicitely set the step for hiera in the deploy_steps_tasks.
The reason we need it is because in non-HA the iptables rules would
be created at step 1. But since the deploy_steps_tasks run before the
actual tasks that set the step hieradata.we would get the following
error:
Error: Function lookup() did not find a value for the name 'step'

We can just write out the step hiera key during the deploy_steps_tasks,
it will be enforced again shortly afterwards once the
common/deploy-steps-tasks.yaml gets invoked.

We also switch back to puppet_execute: ::tripleo::profile::base::haproxy
even for the pacemaker profile. This was broken by the flattening of the
haproxy service (Id55ae44a7b1b5f08b40170f7406e14973fa93639)

Co-Authored-By: Luca Miccini <lmiccini@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Iab310207ca17a6c596470dda30a39e029c4fe09c
Closes-Bug: #1828250

subject: Fix Senlin performance issues
messages:
[{'account_id': 28438, 'date': '2019-02-25 17:15:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25674, 'date': '2019-02-26 20:07:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hey Pavel, So I address this exact same issue in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639420/ if you want to take a look at it. My approach is a little different as I rely more heavily on joining tables together. 

The thing I am trying to avoid is doing Database calls during each assembly of an object. Such as your change to the node object. p = profile_obj.Profile.get(context, db_obj['profile_id']) 

This approach becomes troublesome when there are hundreds/thousands of nodes as any time a list operation is called it will create an additional db call for each of these objects that it returns. 

A prime example of this performance problem can be observed in the Action object's to_dict() method where we call out to get the depended/dependent for every single action causing the cluster action list command to take an extreme amount of time to return when the action table fills up. 

I don't claim to be a sqlalchemy expert so any insight into my patch would be very helpful."}, {'account_id': 25674, 'date': '2019-03-05 23:39:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Should already be addressed by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639420/

We merged the above patch in please let me know if you have any issues with these updates I would very much appreciate your feedback.'}, {'account_id': 22998, 'date': '2019-05-13 18:01:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

I remove `joinedload_all` query operation and fix
dependnencies for node object.
This way I disable processing of excess related resources.

Closes-Bug: #1817604
Change-Id: I800c93f6f6ec9c6e492592df6e47d0dd912d1f4c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Senlin performance issues

I remove `joinedload_all` query operation and fix
dependnencies for node object.
This way I disable processing of excess related resources.

Closes-Bug: #1817604
Change-Id: I800c93f6f6ec9c6e492592df6e47d0dd912d1f4c

commit_message:
Reproducer-quickstart-deprecated fails due to wrong version of cached
Cirros image

Reproducer-quickstart-deprecated jobs fails at validation step due to
wrong version of cached cirros test image in the tempest-setup.sh.
This is set by `tempest_test_image_path` in changed here CI
configuration files. Bumping here the version of image solves this bug.

Change-Id: I1b6d4e0c3dd7b84a389fedf1562332862616c101
Closes-Bug: 1828746

commit_message:
Extend cluster events

This patch extends adds a new field 'instance_ids' in payloads of two
cluster events:
     - DBaaSClusterShrink (during start and end notification),
     - DBaaSClusterGrow (during end notification).

Moreover, additional end notifications after growing and shrinking
cluster have been added.

The purpose of this change if to enable better integration with
tools for monitoring resources usage.

Change-Id: I2c39b2c3bff65f88e46944eda22209bdc92803bc

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-13 07:18:05.000000000', 'message': "Add upper-constraints enforcement for local reqs

This adds the use of upper constraints in our tox environments. Jobs
like openstack-tox-py27 have started failing due to trying to install
lib versions that only support Python 3.

The 'generate' target keeps the unconstrained deps since we actually do
need the latest installed for that.

Updates the requirements-integration job to run using py36 since that
now fails with running under py27. This should get the job to pass until
we are able to rewrite it to not be a legacy job.

NOTE(dmllr): updated install_command to include local constraints file

Change-Id: I2598503c2d4397d7efbb03a76df9a4e91dd0c1cf

commit_message:
Add upper-constraints enforcement for local reqs

This adds the use of upper constraints in our tox environments. Jobs
like openstack-tox-py27 have started failing due to trying to install
lib versions that only support Python 3.

The 'generate' target keeps the unconstrained deps since we actually do
need the latest installed for that.

NOTE(dmllr): updated install_command to include local constraints file

Change-Id: I2598503c2d4397d7efbb03a76df9a4e91dd0c1cf
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8bad9fe19d09eb2e49fd44b92c57ee5acf85b558)
(cherry picked from commit ab0875127bd23cf18c549440b9e0130d5162b73d)

commit_message:
Move Object Depencency Lifecycle spec to Rocky

The work around the object dependency lifecycle spec was completed rocky
when the @depends and associated magic attribute handling for the
managers was eliminated for the single-instnatiation set of managers
directly referenced instead of self.XXXX_api

Change-Id: I5469195ff97bf1a36ce3936c2ad497f70b42470f

commit_message:
Move 'functional testing' spec to attic

As discussed at the Denver (2019) PTG, this spec is not super useful as
proposed. We have started work to improve our testing in a number of
ways. If the specific use-case of functional testing as proposed in the
spec receives interest the spec can be retrieved from the attic.

Change-Id: I238b16a30f131bf9d6a754c4dda48ac8e83a51b0

commit_message:
api-ref: 'os-hypervisors' doesn't reflect overcommit ratio

We could/should introduce an API microversion to correct this or remove
it, given that placement should be the go-to reference for this stuff
going forward. However, for now we take the path of least resistance and
document the broken behavior.

Change-Id: Id8532d5a9480e4f71a9390e3b98886c85e27d003
